0.title: Tried therapy but it didn't work; I couldn't open up: Ajay on mental health
0.article_body: Ajay Devgn revealed he's an introverted person and said he can't open up to people. He added that it's one of the problems he doesn't like about himself. The actor also revealed he tried therapy but it didn't work for him as he still couldn't open up. However, Ajay said, he tries to sort things out in his own head.

1.title: 55-year-old woman resists knife attack by robbers in Pune, injured
1.article_body: A 55-year-old woman was injured when she tried to resist knife attack by one of five robbers who broke into her house on Sunday in Pune. Robbers held her and her 60-year-old husband at knifepoint and robbed her of mangalsutra and gold earrings. When they asked for more valuables, woman resisted, following which, one of them tried to attack her.

2.title: Arrest warrant issued against ex-BJP official in K’taka SI exam scam
2.article_body: Karnataka Police has issued a non-bailable warrant against former President of the BJP women's unit in Kalaburagi, Divya Hagaragi, in connection with cheating during the recruitment exam for Sub-Inspectors. Hagaragi runs a school, which was an exam centre, where candidates were helped in cheating to score high marks. Her husband Rajesh Hagaragi and three teachers were earlier arrested.

3.title: Pregnant woman pushed, abused on Mumbai local train; accused booked
3.article_body: A pregnant woman was pushed and abused by a fellow passenger in a Mumbai local train on Monday. According to police, the victim had boarded the first-class ladies coach and amidst the crowd, she mistakenly hit another woman. The accused woman then grabbed the back of the victim's clothes and began shoving her while verbally abusing her, police said.

4.title: Our morals gelled together, it was taken for granted we'll marry: Ajay on Kajol
4.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that he and actress Kajol started seeing each other without any proposal and that it was taken for granted they will marry. He further said that their thoughts were similar and that their morals gelled together. "It just went in a flow," he added. He also said that there are ups and downs in every marriage.

5.title: BMC conducts pre-monsoon survey, spots 337 dilapidated buildings
5.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has identified 337 dilapidated buildings across Mumbai in its pre-monsoon survey, down from 465 last year. The most dilapidated buildings (163) are in western suburbs, followed by 104 in eastern suburbs and 70 in the island city, data showed. The survey is conducted to prevent loss of life and property in case of building collapse.

6.title: Bengaluru reports 82 of Karnataka's 85 new COVID-19 cases
6.article_body: Karnataka on Tuesday recorded 85 new COVID-19 cases and zero coronavirus-related deaths. Of the total cases, 82 infections were reported from Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 66 recoveries during the same period. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,626 with a positivity rate of 2.36%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

7.title: Cocaine worth ₹11.57 cr seized from Tanzanian national at Hyd airport
7.article_body: Cocaine weighing 1.157 kilograms worth ₹11.57 crore was seized from a Tanzanian national at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The passenger had arrived from Johannesburg via Dubai. "When enquired, he revealed...he had swallowed capsules containing cocaine...passenger purged 22 capsules at the airport and sought immediate medical assistance," Directorate of Revenue Intelligence said.

8.title: Probe into custodial death of Unnao vegetable vendor not fair: SC
8.article_body: The Supreme Court has said that the probe into the alleged custodial death of a vegetable vendor, Mohd Faizal, in UP's Unnao last year "cannot be said to be fair and impartial". The court said that it had the option to transfer the case to CBI, however, ordered a senior police officer from Lucknow to personally undertake further investigation.

9.title: 11 killed, 15 injured after temple chariot comes in contact with live wire in TN
9.article_body: At least 11 people including children died and 15 others were injured after electrocution during a chariot procession at Appar temple in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur district on Wednesday, police said. The chariot was at a bending, trying to turn when it faced some obstacle and reversed. While reversing, it came in contact with overhead line and went up in flames.

10.title: Kohli far from hitting good form, RCB might look to give him a break: RP Singh
10.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has said RCB might consider giving a break to Virat Kohli if he fails to score in the next couple of matches. "He is a big player no doubt, but it must be said that he is not in form...he's far away from hitting good form," Singh stated. Kohli got out after scoring 9(10) against RR.

11.title: Be wary of parties trying to divide people on caste, communal lines: KCR
11.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) on Tuesday said that people should be wary of the political parties that are trying to "divide" on caste and communal lines. "India is a great nation which treats people of all communities, castes and religions equally. If this harmony is disturbed, we would be lost forever," Rao added.

12.title: Tesla loses $126 billion in value amid Musk Twitter deal funding concerns
12.article_body: Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that CEO Elon Musk may have to sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44 billion buyout of Twitter. Tesla isn't involved in Twitter deal, however its shares have been targeted by speculators after Musk declined to disclose where his cash for the acquisition is coming from.

13.title: RCB's Harshal Patel refuses to shake hands with RR's Riyan Parag, video goes viral
13.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel refused to shake hands with RR all-rounder Riyan Parag after the conclusion of their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. Harshal was seen ignoring Parag and walking past him when players were greeting each other. Earlier in the match, the duo got involved in a verbal fight after Parag hit 18 runs off Harshal's over.

14.title: China's DJI to halt Russia, Ukraine sales to see products not used in war
14.article_body: Chinese drone maker DJI Technology will temporarily suspend business in Russia and Ukraine to ensure its products are not used in the war. "DJI abhors any use of our drones to cause harm, and we are temporarily suspending sales in these countries," DJI said. Ukrainian officials and citizens have accused DJI of leaking data on the Ukrainian military to Russia.

15.title: Man sets his Ola e-bike on fire over battery charge issue in TN; shares video
15.article_body: A man poured petrol on his Ola e-bike and set it on fire in Tamil Nadu over battery charge issue. The man named Prithv Raj posted video of the burning e-bike on Twitter. He had earlier shared the screenshot of the email that he sent to Ola Electric customer care. "Regarding sudden drop in charge," the email's subject read.

16.title: Gurugram reports over 400 COVID-19 cases in single day since February 10
16.article_body: Gurugram on Tuesday reported 409 new COVID-19 cases and 334 recoveries following which the number of active cases in the district went up to 1,380, as per the health bulletin. The last time Gurugram reported over 400 new COVID-19 cases was on February 10 with 413 cases. Gurugram's COVID-19 positivity rate on Tuesday stood at 10.47%.

17.title: 250 inmates of Pune jail to get loans under Maha bank's scheme
17.article_body: The Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank (MSCB) will start a loan scheme for prisoners from Yerawada jail. Under the first phase of the scheme, 250 prison inmates will be getting loans, following which, the scheme will be extended to other prisons in the state. The chairman of the bank said MSCB is first bank in India to give loans to inmates.

18.title: Germany to supply Ukraine with 50 Gepard anti-aircraft tanks
18.article_body: The German government on Tuesday said it will supply Ukraine with 50 Gepard anti-aircraft tanks amid its war with Russia. Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said during a US-hosted defence conference at the US airbase in Ramstein that Germany will double its military support to Ukraine to €2 billion. Lambrecht added that Ukrainian troops will be trained on German soil.

19.title: RR defend lowest total in IPL 2022 against RCB, jump to top of points table
19.article_body: RR defeated RCB by 29 runs on Tuesday to record their third victory in a row in IPL 2022. With the victory, RR jumped to top of the points table. RR put up a total of 144/8 and went on to dismiss RCB for 115 in 19.3 overs. RR's 144/8 is the lowest defended total in IPL 2022 so far.

20.title: Utter abuse of law: Kumar Vishvas as he seeks to quash FIR against him
20.article_body: Calling the FIR registered against him by the Punjab Police as an "utter abuse of the process of law", former AAP leader Kumar Vishvas has moved the Punjab and Haryana High Court, seeking to quash it. Punjab Police filed an FIR against him on April 12 for making provocative statements against Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal.

21.title: PM to visit Assam to lay foundation stone for projects on April 28
21.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Assam on April 28 to lay the foundation stone for several projects including Veterinary College (Diphu), Degree College (West Karbi Anglong) and Agricultural College (Kolonga, West Karbi Anglong). The PM will also address a rally at Diphu in Karbi Anglong district, as per the Prime Minister's office.

22.title: After PMs meet on COVID-19, curbs to resume at airports: K'taka CM
22.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that precautionary measures at airports may be reintroduced after the Prime Minister’s meeting on COVID-19. "Depending on advisory from the Centre following the PM’s meeting with CMs tomorrow, all precautionary measures will resume at airports and border districts, especially those bordering Maharashtra and Kerala," Bommai stated.

23.title: Covid-19 cases on a slight rise, but no need to panic: K'taka CM
23.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that there is a slight rise in Covid-19 cases in the state, but there's no need to panic at the moment. The government has decided to make wearing face masks mandatory, he stated. "We will take steps based on the advice of the central government after meeting with PM Modi on April 27," he added.

24.title: US Open champion Raducanu parts ways with coach after 6 months
24.article_body: US Open champion Emma Raducanu has split with coach Torben Beltz six months after hiring him. "I feel the best direction for my development is to transition to a new training model with the (British tennis federation) supporting in the interim," he added. The 19-year-old reached career-high ranking of number 11 this week after reaching the quarterfinals at Stuttgart Open.

25.title: 'Hatti' community will be added in ST list by Centre: HP CM
25.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah has assured that the Centre will include the state's 'Hatti' community in the Scheduled Tribes list. "The Hatti community has been demanding tribal status for long time. I met Amit Shah and discussed this...Hatti community will be given the status of tribal community," Thakur said.

26.title: Massive fire breaks out at Bhalswa landfill in Delhi; 4th such incident in a month
26.article_body: A massive fire broke out at the Bhalswa landfill site in Delhi on Tuesday, the fourth such large-scale fire in Delhi's landfill areas over the last month. Around 10 fire tenders are at the spot to douse the fire, officials said. "It's not yet known whether the fire was caused by methane generation or some human activity," an official said.

27.title: Your heart will obviously be racing: PBKS' Rishi on bowling to Dhoni
27.article_body: Talking about bowling to MS Dhoni in final over against CSK in IPL 2022, PBKS pacer Rishi Dhawan said everyone's heart will obviously be racing when the CSK wicketkeeper-batter is on the crease. "I knew that if I bowled two good balls, we would win the match easily...whole crowd was with him," he added. Rishi dismissed Dhoni at 12 runs.

28.title: Russia warns UK of 'proportional response' for provoking Ukraine
28.article_body: The Russian Defence Ministry on Tuesday warned of a "proportional response" if the UK continued to provoke Ukraine to strike targets in Russia. "Russian Armed Forces are in...readiness to launch retaliatory strikes with high-precision...weapons at decision-making centers in Kyiv," it added. Representatives of a certain Western country in Kyiv maybe harmed in these strike, it further said.

29.title: 8.3 million refugees expected from Ukraine this year: UN
29.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) on Tuesday said it expects around 8.3 million people to flee Ukraine this year following Russia's invasion. UNHCR spokesperson Shabia Mantoo said over 12.7 million have fled their homes in the past two months, including 7.7 million people displaced internally in Ukraine and over 5 million people that have fled Ukraine so far.

30.title: Bus carrying 35 people catches fire on MP highway, no one injured
30.article_body: A bus carrying 35 people suddenly caught fire while travelling on the National Highway in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district on Tuesday. Four fire brigades attended and all passengers were rescued, however, their luggage was reduced to ashes. The fire reportedly started after a bike kept on top of the bus started leaking petrol which then caught fire due to heat.

31.title: World Bank agreed to provide $600 mn in financial aid: Sri Lanka
31.article_body: The Sri Lankan President's media division in a statement on Tuesday said, "The World Bank has agreed to provide $600 million in financial assistance to address the current economic crisis." The World Bank would release $400 million shortly, it added. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

32.title: Paul Scholes labels Paul Pogba ‘a big disappointment’ at Man Utd
32.article_body: Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Scholes has labelled Paul Pogba as "a big disappointment" at the club. The French international is expected to leave when his contract expires at the end of this season. "I just don't think he's ever learned as a footballer, he constantly seems to make the same mistakes over and over again," Scholes said.

33.title: Nearly 6,000 foreign migrants detained in Mexico in 4 days
33.article_body: Mexico's National Migration Institute (INM) on Monday said nearly 6,000 foreign migrants were detained in Mexico in four days. The INM said the majority of the 5,688 migrants that were detained from April 21 to 24 were found in trailers, safe houses or hidden in truck cabins or bus compartments. Over 1,000 of the migrants detained were from Honduras.

34.title: Russia, Belarus banned from hosting international skating events
34.article_body: The International Skating Union (ISU) said Russia and Belarus will not be allowed to host international skating events following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The ISU had previously banned Russian and Belarusian skaters from participating in international competitions. The ISU added it is looking for a replacement host for the Rostelecom Cup that is scheduled to take place in November.

35.title: Man charred to death as car catches fire in Punjab's Faridkot
35.article_body: A 61-year-old man, identified as Harminder Singh, was burnt alive after his car caught fire in Faridkot, Punjab. "Harminder noticed a fire in his car as he approached Shahi Haveli restaurant. He pulled over on the side and tried to get out," a police official said. But due to fire, the doors were jammed and the driver could not escape.

36.title: 20-year-old girl abducted, raped by neighbour in MP's Ujjain
36.article_body: A 20-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped by a neighbour in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain in March following which a complaint was filed on Sunday, police said. The victim, a BCom student, was reportedly walking home when the accused offered her a lift. He then allegedly proposed marriage before taking her to an abandoned place and sexually assaulting her.

37.title: 190-year-old Charlotte Bronte book of poems sold for ₹9.6 crore, pic released
37.article_body: A tiny book of 10 unpublished poems by renowned English novelist Charlotte Bronte has sold for $1.25 million (₹9.58 crore) at the New York Antiquarian Book Fair. The book is titled 'A Book of Ryhmes by Charlotte Bronte, Sold by Nobody, and Printed by Herself' and is dated 1829. The poems were written by Bronte when she was 13.

38.title: 'Forever 21 lost out on $150 mn in online sales,' says parent firm; sues Bolt
38.article_body: Forever 21's parent company Authentic Brands Group (ABG) has sued American payments startup Bolt, alleging that the startup failed to deliver promised technology. ABG also said that during Bolt's integration with Forever 21, the clothing retailer lost out on over $150 million in online sales. Bolt called ABG's claims "a transparent attempt" to renegotiate the terms of the companies' agreements.

39.title: I once rejected Dhirubhai's tender & he had asked, 'Sarkar ki kya aukat hai?': Gadkari
39.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari during a News24 event said that he rejected Dhirubhai Ambani's tender for Mumbai-Pune highway while serving as a minister in Mumbai in 1995. Gadkari revealed, "Dhirubhai angrily asked me, 'Sarkar ki kya aukat hai? Aap kya road banaoge'." Gadkari added, "When Dhirubhai later saw the road's work...he was so nice...he told me, 'I lost, you won'."

40.title: Getting intimidated by Big B, Ajay would be my failure as actor: Rakul
40.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, on working with actors Amitabh Bachchan and Ajay Devgn in 'Runway 34', said that if she gives in to intimidation or nervous energy then it's her failure as an actor. The actress further said that she craves to do things with better actors, adding that doing so pushes you also to do better.

41.title: Russia expels 40 German diplomats in 'symmetrical response'
41.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Monday said it declared 40 German diplomats in Russia "persona non grata" in a "symmetrical response" following Germany's expulsion of 40 Russian diplomats on April 4. "We expected today's step, but it is in no way justified," German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said in a statement. Baerbock added the expelled diplomats had "not done anything wrong".

42.title: Telangana CM to introduce 11 resolutions on TRS' foundation day
42.article_body: On the occasion of Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) 21st foundation day on Wednesday, Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao will introduce 11 resolutions of its government. IT and Industries Minister KT Rama Rao said that the CM will release the vision and introduce resolutions. "We'll discuss how COVID-19 situation was dealt. Demonetisation and Centre's incompetence will be discussed," KTR stated.

43.title: US Vice President Kamala Harris tests COVID-19 positive
43.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday but is asymptomatic and not considered a current close contact of President Joe Biden, the White House said. "She...will isolate and continue to work from the Vice President's residence," said Harris' Press Secretary, Kirsten Allen. Allen added that Harris would "return to the White House when she tests negative".

44.title: IGNOU has emerged as a modern-day Lord Hanuman: Dharmendra Pradhan
44.article_body: Addressing the 35th convocation of the Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU), Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan called the university a "modern-day Hanuman". He said, "IGNOU has emerged as a modern-day Lord Hanuman in taking education and learning to the remotest corners and to the poorest." He also added that IGNOU should become the knowledge centre of the world.

45.title: Ukrainian farmers wear bulletproof vests to work in fields amid war
45.article_body: Ukrainian farmers in the Zaporizhzhia region have started wearing bullet proof vests while working in their fields amid the conflict in the country. The region borders the frontline of the military conflict with Russia. "We...put on our vests and...then go to fields. If there is shelling, we pack up and go to the office," a local farmer said.

46.title: Not worthy for a world champion: Mercedes’ Wolff after Emilia Romagna GP
46.article_body: Team boss Toto Wolff said Mercedes' W13 car this season is "not worthy for a world champion" after seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton finished 13th in the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix last Sunday. Hamilton's teammate George Russell finished in fourth place. Red Bulls' Max Verstappen won the race finishing ahead of teammate Sergio Perez and McLaren's Lando Norris.

47.title: Red Bull’s Verstappen wins Laureus World Sportsman of the Year Award
47.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen has been named the 2022 Laureus World Sportsman of the Year after winning his maiden Formula One world championship last season. Verstappen claimed 10 pole positions, 10 race victories and finished on the podium a record 18 times last season. Other F1 drivers to have won the award are Michael Schumacher, Sebastian Vettel and Lewis Hamilton.

48.title: Major fire breaks out in godowns in Pune's Kondhwa area
48.article_body: A major fire broke out in Parge Nagar in Pune's Kondhwa area, damaging five-six godowns before firefighters could extinguish the fire. "These are tin-shed shops located in close vicinity of each other. Shops include those selling furniture, automobile garage, vehicle body workshop, and so on. The cause of the fire is not clear yet," said fire station officer Sameer Shaikh.

49.title: Actress Tabu begins shooting for 'Drishyam 2', shares photo from sets
49.article_body: Actress Tabu has begun shooting for the sequel to her 2015 crime thriller film 'Drishyam'. Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, the actress shared a picture of clapboard, and wrote, "Day 1. Drishyam 2." The film is directed by Abhishek Pathak and will also feature Ajay Devgn, Shriya Saran and Ishita Dutta Sheth. The shooting is reportedly being held in Goa.

50.title: World no. 4 Rafael Nadal announces return from injury at Madrid Open
50.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal on Tuesday said he will return from his month-long injury at the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Madrid that begins later this week. Nadal, 35, suffered a stress fracture in his rib during the Indian Wells tournament last month where he last played in the final against Taylor Fritz on March 20.

51.title: There'a a set audience that's in to watch sequels: Tara Sutaria
51.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria in an interview has stated that she feels there is a set audience who loves the first part of films and would be in to watch its sequels. She further said that she doesn't think about commerce but about entertaining family audiences through her work. Tara made her debut with 2019 film 'Student of the Year 2'.

52.title: Russia removed as hosts of men's 2023 Ice Hockey World Championship
52.article_body: The International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF) said Russia has been removed as hosts of the men's 2023 Ice Hockey World Championship that was to be played in Russian President Vladimir Putin's home city St. Petersburg. The IIHF said Russia was removed due to "concern for the safety and well-being of all participating players, officials, media and fans".

53.title: Kazakhstan Prez quits ruling party, transfers leadership to ally
53.article_body: Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev on Tuesday quit the country's ruling party Amanat and handed over its chairmanship to his ally Yerlan Koshanov. President Tokayev's move reportedly comes as part of his plan to make country's political landscape more competitive. Yerlan Koshanov is the current speaker of lower house of parliament and previously served as the president's chief of staff.

54.title: Actor Dhanush's first look from Russo Brothers' 'The Gray Man' out
54.article_body: Actor Dhanush's first look from his upcoming Hollywood film 'The Gray Man' is out. The film will be directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, who have also directed 'Avengers: Endgame'. 'The Gray Man' will feature 'Captain America' actor Chris Evans and actor Ryan Gosling in the lead roles. Actress Ana de Armas will also star in the film.

55.title: Delhi reports over 1,200 COVID-19 cases and 1 death in last 24 hrs
55.article_body: Delhi reported 1,204 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, marking the fifth day of over 1,000 new cases in the city. The national capital also reported one coronavirus-related death on Tuesday, while 863 people recovered from the disease in one day. The number of active cases in Delhi now stands at 4,508, while the positivity rate is 4.64%.

56.title: Less than 1 malaria case per 1,000 population in MP: Minister
56.article_body: The current malaria infection rate in Madhya Pradesh has declined to below 1 case per 1,000 population, Health Minister Dr Prabhuram Choudhary said. He added that there was a drop of over 50% in cases between 2012 and 2020. He further detailed the government's strategies to curb malaria which included fogging, spraying chemicals, free treatment and awareness programmes among others.

57.title: UK to supply ambulances, fire engines to Ukraine amid Russian war
57.article_body: The British government said it will provide Ukraine with ambulances, medical supplies, fire engines and funding for health experts to help the country's emergency services amid its war with Russia. Over 40 fire engines have already been dispatched to Ukraine with rescue equipment, thermal imaging cameras and around 10,000 pieces of protective clothing.

58.title: No house arrest for Navlakha, will stay in jail: Bombay High Court
58.article_body: The Bombay High Court dismissed activist Gautam Navlakha's plea seeking transfer from Taloja Central Prison to judicial custody in the form of house arrest, as the jail lacked basic facilities. "The petitioner would be at liberty to bring to the attention of the presiding officer of special NIA court the grievances in respect of difficulties faced by him," court said.

59.title: 20 lakh children risk starving to death in Horn of Africa: UN
59.article_body: Nearly 20 lakh children risk starving to death in the Horn of Africa amid severe droughts, according to UN aid chief Martin Griffiths. Parts of Kenya, Ethiopia and Somalia are facing the driest conditions in more than 40 years. The UN has only a fraction of the $1.4 billion it needs to respond to the crisis, Griffiths said.

60.title: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' earns over ₹900 crore worldwide in 12 days
60.article_body: Yash-starrer Kannada film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' earned over ₹900 crore at the worldwide box office within 12 days of its release. Film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan on Tuesday took to Twitter to share the numbers earned by the film. 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'  also stars Sanjay Dutt as the villain Adheera along with Raveena Tandon as the Prime Minister.

61.title: Declare your and family's assets: UP CM to Ministers, IAS officers
61.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has asked his ministers, IAS and IPS officers to declare all property owned by them and their family members within three months. He added, "All ministers should ensure that there is no interference of their family members in the government work. We have to set an example by our conduct."

62.title: Centre to grant ST status to Hatti community soon: Himachal CM
62.article_body: The Centre will soon grant the Scheduled Tribes status to the Hatti community, said Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Tuesday. "The Hatti community has been demanding ST status for a long time," he said. The community had a population of 2.5 lakhs as per the 2011 Census, which has now increased to about 3 lakhs, Thakur added.

63.title: Which COVID-19 vaccines have been approved for children today?
63.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday announced that India's Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation has given 'emergency usage' approval for children to three COVID-19 vaccines. Covaxin has been approved for children aged between six and 12. While Corbevax has been approved for children aged between five and 12, ZyCoV-D has been approved for those above 12.

64.title: Roger Federer to return to court in October, last played in July 2021
64.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer is planning to return to tournament tennis at Swiss Indoors in October. The event at Basel announced that Federer "has officially entered the tournament and will appear on the entry list with protected ATP ranking of number nine." The 40-year-old hasn't played since losing in Wimbledon quarterfinals in July 2021.

65.title: RCB's Harshal Patel involved in verbal fight with RR's Riyan Parag, video goes viral
65.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel and RR all-rounder Riyan Parag got involved in a verbal fight after the end of RR's innings. Parag hit Harshal for 18 runs in the last over of RR's innings. The duo were seen exchanging words while walking back for the innings break. Harshal was then seen being held back by a member of RR contingent.

66.title: Over 86% adult population fully vaccinated against COVID-19: Govt
66.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said over 86% of India's adult population has been fully vaccinated against COVID-19. "Way to go! Over 86% of the adult population is now fully vaccinated. Together, let's defeat COVID-19," Mandaviya tweeted. The Health Ministry also informed that India's COVID-19 vaccination drive has achieved the milestone of administering 188 crore doses.

67.title: Chernobyl radiation abnormal since Russian occupation: IAEA chief
67.article_body: During a visit to Chernobyl nuclear plant site on Tuesday, International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Director General Rafael Grossi claimed that the radiation levels in the area are abnormal. Grossi visited the plant on the anniversary of the world's worst nuclear disaster that took place there in 1986. The site was briefly occupied by Russian forces invading Ukraine.

68.title: Andhra man carries son's body on bike after ambulances charge ₹20,000 for 90 km
68.article_body: A man in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati was forced to carry his 10-year-old son's dead body on a motorcycle after private ambulance drivers at a government-run hospital allegedly demanded huge money ranging from ₹18,000-₹20,000 for 90 kilometres. The drivers also allegedly stopped another ambulance from carrying the body and attacked its driver. Meanwhile, police have arrested six drivers in the case.

69.title: '#leavingtwitter' trends on Twitter in India after Elon Musk buys the platform
69.article_body: Hours after Elon Musk announced that he was buying Twitter for $44 billion, '#leavingtwitter' began trending on Twitter in India. The hashtag was used in over 29,000 tweets, with tweets like, "Finally, it's out there: Twitter is an autocratic platform as Elon Musk buys Twitter #leavingtwitter." Several users also used the hashtag to troll people leaving Twitter over Musk's takeover.

70.title: About 15,000 Russian troops killed in Ukraine so far: UK’s Wallace
70.article_body: Britain's Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Monday said Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24 has cost the lives of about 15,000 Russian troops so far. He said that Russian armed forces have lost at least 530 tanks, 530 armoured personnel carriers and over 60 helicopters and fighter jets. Wallace added that he does not celebrate Russia's losses.

71.title: Sony Pictures officially announces Tom Hardy-starrer 'Venom 3'
71.article_body: The third instalment of the Tom Hardy-starrer 'Venom' franchise has been officially announced by Sony Pictures at the CinemaCon 2022. The first film in the franchise was released in 2018. It was followed by 'Venom: Let There Be Carnage', featuring Tom and Woody Harrelson. Tom's character Eddie Brock also had a cameo in Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

72.title: I quit my corporate job to become an actor: 'Jersey' actor Saurabh
72.article_body: Actor Saurabh V Pandey, who recently starred in Shahid Kapoor's film 'Jersey', has revealed that he had a corporate job but he quit that to be an actor. "I knew it was a big risk in terms of my career...there were many rejections and endless auditions," he stated. Saurabh played the captain of the Punjab Cricket Team in the film.

73.title: Turkey lifts indoor mask mandate as daily COVID-19 cases drop
73.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan announced on Tuesday that wearing masks indoors will no longer be required. The move comes amid a drop in daily COVID-19 cases with 2,604 infections reported in the last 24 hours. Erdoğan, however, added that wearing masks at medical institutions and on public transport will remain mandatory till daily infections fall below 1,000.

74.title: Once we get going, KKR will be unstoppable in IPL 2022: Shreyas
74.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said his side would be "unstoppable as a team" once they get going in IPL 2022. "We are ticking all the boxes to get on to the field and win matches. It's just the execution part (where we are lacking)," he added. KKR have lost five out of eight matches, including four in a row.

75.title: Dalai Lama's Panchen Lama is leading a normal life: China
75.article_body: A young Tibetan chosen as Panchen Lama by Dalai Lama is leading a normal life as an ordinary Chinese citizen, China's Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday. "He and his family don't want their normal life to be disturbed," it added. The remarks come after the US raised concerns about the whereabouts of the man, who has been missing since 1995.

76.title: SEBI issues ₹2.05-cr recovery notice to ex-NSE official Subramanian
76.article_body: SEBI on Tuesday sent a notice to NSE's ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian, asking him to pay ₹2.05 crore in a case pertaining to governance lapses at NSE. This comes after Subramanian had earlier failed to pay a ₹2-crore fine to SEBI. In the event of non-payment of the latest fine, SEBI may recover the amount by selling Subramanian's assets.

77.title: Dhawan has been a serious player: Shastri after Dhawan's 88* vs CSK
77.article_body: Ravi Shastri has praised Shikhar Dhawan for his match-winning 88*-run knock in his 200th IPL match against CSK. "He's seeing what the pitch had to offer...[and] what his role was," he added. "This man has been a serious player...he deserves all the accolades," he further said. On Monday, Dhawan became second player after Virat Kohli to score 6000 IPL runs.

78.title: Delhi HC directs AIIMS nurses on strike to rejoin work 'immediately'
78.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday directed the AIIMS Nurses' Union to ensure that its nurses, who are on strike, immediately rejoin work. The union had earlier announced an indefinite strike on account of the suspension of its President Harish Kajla, demanding its revocation and stopping of all kinds of retaliative measures against union executives of the main OT.

79.title: MP CM meets family of ragging victim who died by suicide, assures justice
79.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday met the family members of Chetan Patidar, a first-year student in Indore's Index Medical College who died by suicide last month. He assured the family of justice and said that people accused of ragging would not be spared. The family alleged that Chetan took the step after being harassed by senior students.

80.title: Ponting said 'I want you to play all 14 games' in IPL 2022: DC's Kuldeep
80.article_body: Recalling his first practice session with DC head coach Ricky Ponting ahead of IPL 2022, spinner Kuldeep Yadav said he loved the way the Australian motivated him as he hadn't played IPL in almost two years. "Ricky told me 'You are bowling well. I want you to play all 14 games. That's my approach. Don't worry about anything'," he added.

81.title: Will myself meet woman's family: NCW Chairperson on Dausa rape case
81.article_body: The National Commission for Women Chairperson Rekha Sharma on Tuesday said that she along with a team will go to Rajasthan's Dausa to meet the family of the woman, who was gang-raped and murdered. "The rape & murder of the woman is gruesome. Such incidents are repeatedly happening in Rajasthan," she said.

82.title: Prashanth & I have thought of a lot of scenes for 'KGF 3': Actor Yash
82.article_body: Actor Yash revealed that he and the film's director Prashanth Neel have thought of many scenes for 'KGF: Chapter 3'. "There are a lot of things which we couldn't do in 'KGF: Chapter 2'. So we know there are a lot of possibilities, a lot of kick-a** scenes are there," he further stated. "But it's just an idea," he added.

83.title: Central Railway to complete monsoon-related work before May 31
83.article_body: Central Railway (CR) General Manager AK Lahoti has directed officials to complete all monsoon-related works before May 31 to ensure smooth and disruption-free train services. He also instructed officials to ensure 24x7 monitoring of all vulnerable locations and to work closely with the state government and municipal corporations. CR has already de-silted 59 km of drains on its suburban section.

84.title: Hope SC will reverse laws applied to J&K after Art 370 abrogation: Mufti
84.article_body: Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti said on Tuesday that she hopes SC will reverse all laws extended to Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) after Article 370 was repealed. Mufti's remarks came after SC agreed to hear pleas challenging the law used to scrap Article 370 in July. Centre revoked Article 370 and bifurcated J&K into two union territories in 2019.

85.title: Man's pic of Iftar on train goes viral, Minister says 'hope you had a good meal'
85.article_body: A man shared a picture of Iftar (evening meal during Ramadan) served to him on a train and thanked the Railways. Shahnawaz Akhtar said a pantry staffer asked him if he was observing 'roza' (fast) and he got the Iftar without asking. Union Minister Darshana Jardosh replied, "Indian Railways family is touched by your comments...hope you had a good meal."

86.title: Cong appoints late ex-Himachal CM Virbhadra Singh's wife Pratibha as state chief
86.article_body: Congress has appointed Lok Sabha MP from Mandi Pratibha Virbhadra Singh as President of Himachal Pradesh Congress Committee. Notably, Singh is the wife of late former Himachal Pradesh CM Virbhadra Singh, who was at the top post for 21 years. Moreover, Congress has appointed Mukesh Agnihotri and Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu as CLP Leader and Chairman of the Campaign Committee, respectively.

87.title: Bajaj Finance reports highest-ever net profit of ₹2,420 cr in Q4
87.article_body: Bajaj Finance reported its highest-ever consolidated profit after tax (PAT) of ₹2,419.51 crore in the January-March 2022 quarter, up 79.67% YoY from ₹1,346.64 crore. The company's net interest income for the quarter rose 30% YoY to ₹6,068 crore against ₹4,659 crore. Its assets under management grew 29% YoY to ₹1.97 lakh crore while new loans grew 15% to 6.28 million.

88.title: Restaurant shut down for preparing samosas in toilets for 30 years in Saudi
88.article_body: Authorities in Saudi Arabia's Jeddah recently shut down a restaurant after they discovered that it had been preparing samosas and other snacks in toilets for over 30 years, local media reported. It reportedly also used expired articles. The authorities said it has sealed off several illegal restaurants and more than a tonne of food stuff were confiscated and destroyed.

89.title: Delete my data published in public or I'll take legal action: Ola Electric customer to firm
89.article_body: Balwant Singh, who claimed his son suffered fractures and 16 stitches in his hands due to Ola Electric scooter's fault in Guwahati, has threatened legal action against Founder Bhavish Aggarwal. Singh asked Ola Electric to immediately take down his telemetry data published in public, allegedly without his consent. "Failure to do so, I'll take legal action against Bhavish," Singh tweeted.

90.title: China reports first human case of H3N8 bird flu
90.article_body: China has recorded the first human infection with the H3N8 strain of bird flu, the country's health authority said on Tuesday, adding that the risk of it spreading among people was low. A four-year-old boy was found to have been infected with the variant after developing a fever and other symptoms. No close contacts were infected with the virus.

91.title: FILA Philippines' 52-yr-old CEO found dead in Singapore, probe launched
91.article_body: Cris Albert, the 52-year-old CEO and owner of Philippines distributor for South Korean sportswear firm FILA Holdings, was found dead in Singapore on April 23. FILA Philippines confirmed her death in a Facebook post on Monday. Albert was found dead at Singapore's Fullerton Bay Hotel, and her death is being investigated by police as an unnatural one, as per reports.

92.title: 1st MP Auto Expo to begin in Indore on April 28, CM to attend on Fri
92.article_body: The 'Madhya Pradesh Auto Show 2022', which is being organised on a large scale for the first time, will begin on April 28. Various meetings and activities will take place at the three-day event which will be held at Indore's Super Corridor Square. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and other cabinet members are expected to attend the event on second day.

93.title: 35-year-old MP jeweller dies by suicide after poisoning wife, sons
93.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who ran a jewellery shop in MP's Raisen district, allegedly died by suicide after poisoning his wife and two sons, aged 10 and 12. His younger son, however, survived and is currently in hospital. According to police, a suicide note was recovered in which the man mentioned financial losses in business as a reason behind the step.

94.title: Spain's King unveils 2.6 mn euros in assets amid transparency bid
94.article_body: Spain's King Felipe VI has made public his personal assets of 2.6 million euros (₹21.25 crore) for the first time. This comes ahead of a Spanish government decree that aims to make the Royal House more transparent. Notably, former King Juan Carlos had left Spain for the UAE in 2020 amid allegations of financial wrongdoing.

95.title: 4-year-old boy dies after being hit by car in MP, driver arrested
95.article_body: A four-year-old boy died after being hit by a car while playing outside his house in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday. The victim was reportedly dragged for around 20 feet as the driver sped up and tried to escape instead of stopping. Locals managed to catch him after he stopped the car at a distance and he was subsequently arrested.

96.title: Tourists sent flying after whale hits their boat off Mexico coast, video surfaces
96.article_body: A group of tourists were left badly injured after a humpback whale smashed into their vessel. The collision happened off the coast of Mexico when the boat was catapulted high into the air after it crashed into the whale. Local reports confirmed an investigation is underway to discover why the boat had not kept a safe distance from the whale.

97.title: Zareen Khan's mom admitted to ICU, actress asks fans to pray for her
97.article_body: Taking to Twitter on Tuesday, actress Zareen Khan said her mother was taken to a hospital on Monday night and added she had been admitted to the ICU. "My mom is very unwell again...Requesting all of you to please pray for my mom's speedy recovery," she tweeted. As per reports, Zareen's mother was admitted to the hospital last month too.

98.title: No one is punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa: Sanjay Raut
98.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that no one was being punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa. Accusing Devendra Fadnavis of misleading people on the Hanuman Chalisa issue, he said, "Trying to get inside someone else's home and destroying their peace is wrong." MP Navneet Rana and her husband were arrested after they threatened to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM's home.

99.title: Mathura unclean due to lack of sanitation mechanism: MP Hema Malini
99.article_body: Hema Malini, who is the BJP MP from UP's Mathura, said the city isn't very clean as crores of pilgrims visit it and there's a lack of mechanism for maintaining cleanliness. Malini, who was speaking at a public event in Gujarat, said, "I've tried and have been trying to change many things. Our (UP) CM Yogiji is helping a lot."

100.title: Install rainwater harvesting system or pay penalty: Indore civic body
100.article_body: The Indore Municipal Corporation has warned residents that failure to install rainwater harvesting system in buildings and commercial establishments by June 15 will invite penalties. Residential building owners can be fined up to ₹5,000 while it can go up to ₹5 Lakh for industrial units. IMC also stated that only treated water can be used for construction and vehicle washing.

101.title: BJP govt in MP couldn't even supply drinking water in 18 yrs: Cong
101.article_body: Congress on Monday criticised the BJP-led Madhya Pradesh government over its inability to provide clean drinking water despite ruling for 18 years. State Congress media department President Jitu Patwari claimed that over 10 lakh water taps were still dry. He further alleged corruption in water projects saying the government is pressurising contractors to buy pipes from three specific companies.

102.title: Cong MLA's son held for submitting fake papers to courts in rape case
102.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLA Murli Morwal's son Karan Morwal, who's been accused of rape, was arrested in Indore on Tuesday for submitting fake medical papers to courts. Karan forged documents while applying for anticipatory bail, claiming to have been admitted to hospital on day of alleged crime. He was previously arrested in case in October 2021 but released on bail.

103.title: 20 booked for attacking woman Sub-Inspector, constable in UP
103.article_body: Twenty people have been booked for attacking a woman Sub-Inspector and a constable when they were enquiring about a dispute in a village in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Tuesday. Superintendent of Police Prashant Verma said that on Monday SI Hemlata and constable Naresh had gone to Devin Tola in the Saraimira area when they were attacked by the locals.

104.title: Russian court orders seizure of Google's assets worth $7 mn: Report
104.article_body: A Russian court has ordered the seizure of 500 million roubles ($6.67 million) worth of Google's property and funds in Russia in connection with Google's restrictions on a Russian firm's YouTube channel, Reuters reported citing news agencies. The case concerns GPM Entertainment Television. News agency RIA reported that the court had rejected a previous claim by GPM on April 13.

105.title: Wimbledon defend ban on Russian and Belarusian players
105.article_body: Wimbledon had "no viable alternative" but ban Russian and Belarusian players from this year's Championships under the guidance provided by the British government, Chairman of the All England Club Ian Hewitt said on Tuesday. The decision was taken due to Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine which started in February. Notably, Wimbledon became the first major tournament to take this step.

106.title: Old gold, old friends still best: Sidhu on meeting Prashant Kishor
106.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Tuesday met Prashant Kishor after he declined the offer to join the party and said that "old wine, old gold and old friends" are still the best. After declining Congress' offer, Prashant Kishor said that the party needs "leadership and collective will" to fix deep-rooted structural problems through transformational reforms.

107.title: Centre cancels foreign funding licences of NGOs CHRI, AAWW
107.article_body: The Union Home Ministry has cancelled the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) licences of two NGOs, Commonwealth Human Rights Initiative (CHRI) and Apne Aap Women Worldwide (AAWW). The action was taken over violation of the law and diverting of funds received from abroad, officials said on Tuesday. Notably, the FCRA licence is needed to receive funds from abroad.

108.title: Cong panel recommends removal of KV Thomas from all his posts
108.article_body: Congress' disciplinary committee on Tuesday recommended the removal of veteran party leader KV Thomas from all party posts. The move comes weeks after Thomas and fellow party leader Sunil Jakhar were issued show-cause notices for alleged anti-party activities. Thomas was served the notice after he attended a CPI(M) event in Kerala's Kannur earlier this month despite Congress' disapproval.

109.title: Govt does not belong to RSS or VHP: BJP MLC to Pramod Muthalik
109.article_body: BJP MLC and senior leader AH Vishwanath condemned Sri Rama Sene chief Pramod Muthalik for raking up communally sensitive issues in Karnataka. Adding that the government does not belong to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) or the Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), he questioned, "Who is Muthalik to dictate terms to the government and issue communally sensitive statements?"

110.title: Pair of Nike's NFT sneakers that can be worn in metaverse sell for ₹1 crore
110.article_body: A pair of Nike's NFT sneakers, equipped with rare skins, that can be worn in metaverse was sold for over ₹1 crore (45 Ether). Nike recently launched a collection of 20,000 NFT sneakers, along with RTFKT. The sneakers are selling for 2.5 to 3 Ether. The sneakers' appearances can be changed with digital vials, worth at least 0.8 Ether.

111.title: Guj MLA Mevani sent to 5-day police custody in policewoman assault case
111.article_body: An Assam Court has sent Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani to five-day police custody after he was re-arrested for allegedly assaulting a policewoman. Mevani was initially arrested over allegedly objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi and was granted bail on Monday. His lawyer said the second arrest took place less than 30 minutes after he got bail in the first case.

112.title: How has Virat Kohli performed in IPL as an opener?
112.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis announced that Virat Kohli will open against RR today. Kohli has opened the innings for RCB in IPL 76 times. He has scored 2,750 runs as an opener at an average of 43.65 and a strike rate of 136.67. Notably, Kohli has scored each of his five hundreds in IPL while opening.

113.title: World faces largest commodity shock since 1970s: World Bank amid Ukraine war
113.article_body: The World Bank amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war said, "The surging trade restrictions on food, fuel, and fertilisers are aggravating the largest commodity shock we've experienced since the 1970s." The "Major shock" at commodity markets "will keep prices at historically high levels through the end of 2024," said Indermit Gill, VP of Equitable Growth, Finance & Institutions at World Bank.

114.title: Novak Djokovic free to play Wimbledon as COVID-19 vaccination not mandatory
114.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic, who was not allowed to compete at Australian Open due to being unvaccinated against COVID-19, can compete at Wimbledon as COVID-19 vaccination is not mandatory for the athletes. All England Club chief executive Sally Bolton said that it is encouraged that all players get vaccinated, but it won't be a condition of entry to compete.

115.title: Dog almost took Akshay's eye off during a scene in 'Waqt...': Director
115.article_body: Filmmaker Vipul Shah recalled the dog chase sequence from his 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' and said they tied meat on actor Akshay Kumar's back so that the dogs would chase him. "In the last shot of that scene...one dog almost took Akshay's eye off...He simply moved his paw. Thankfully, Akshay has excellent reflexes," he added.

116.title: 99 arrested in 2 months in anti-drug crackdown: Tripura CM
116.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb said that 99 people were arrested under various Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act cases registered in January and February. He tweeted a table comparing the seizure of contraband items by BJP and that under the previous government, CPM, in Tripura. The BJP-led government assumed office in Tripura in March, 2018.

117.title: Footage showing Alec Baldwin practising with gun on 'Rust' set released
117.article_body: Police have released footage showing Alec Baldwin practising drawing a gun in costume on the sets of 'Rust' which later led to cinematographer Halyna Hutchkins' death. As per reports, it is unclear if the footage released is the moment when Halyna was killed. In the ongoing investigation, Alec had earlier claimed that he never pulled the trigger on the sets.

118.title: Secret to my performance professionalism, writers are most important: Big B
118.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, on being asked about the secret of his performance, said that it is professionalism. "Once you've signed a contract and...agreed to being a professional, then whatever is written, or whatever your director is asking you to do, you should do it," he added. The actor further said that the writer is the foremost member of the team.

119.title: CAA a narrowly tailored law, gives relaxation to specific communities: MHA
119.article_body: The Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) is a limited and narrowly tailored legislation that seeks to provide relaxation to specific communities from specified countries, said the Ministry of Home Affairs. CAA, which is yet to be implemented, aims to grant citizenship to those members of the Hindu, Sikh, Parsi and Christian communities who faced persecution in Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh.

120.title: Education officer arrested for taking bribe from a teacher in Maha
120.article_body: A woman education officer was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau for taking bribe from a school teacher in Maharashtra's Palghar. The accused, Lata Sakharam Sanap, had demanded ₹50,000 from the teacher for facilitating his posting at a school in Vasai town. Later, the deal was finalised at ₹25,000, an ACB official said. The accused was caught while accepting the bribe.

121.title: US considered blasting the Moon with nuclear weapons, documents reveal
121.article_body: A now-defunct US government agency considered nuking the Moon, newly released documents have reportedly revealed. The plan reportedly suggested blasting the lunar crust and mantle with thermonuclear weapons to find 'extremely lightweight metals' below the crust. The plan was considered by Advanced Aerospace Threat Identification Program (AATIP) which wanted to build a tunnel through the Moon.

122.title: He has built a rivalry with most of us: Tsitsipas on 18-yr-old Alcaraz
122.article_body: Speaking about 18-year-old Carlos Alcaraz, world number five Stefanos Tsitsipas said building a rivalry with most of the players will help the new world number nine in future. "Don't think it can hurt him in anyway. In the beginning he was the underdog...now...he's more based, people know him better," he added. Alcaraz has won three titles so far in 2022.

123.title: Mamata Banerjee has killed democracy in WB: BJP's Tejasvi Surya
123.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, who led BJP workers' protest rally against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday, said that Banerjee has killed democracy in the state, adding that "she has become Hitler". Surya said, "This [TMC] is a dictatorial government. We're being stripped of our right." This comes after the state police dispersed protesting BJP workers using water cannon.

124.title: Production cost of 'Bade Miyan...' to be around ₹120 cr: Report
124.article_body: The production cost of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' will reportedly be around ₹120 crore. "The production cost...will be around ₹120 crore, which is the highest-ever for an Akshay Kumar film to date," a source stated. The source added the film won't be a remake of the 1998 film as director Ali Abbas Zafar has written a new script.

125.title: Our PM, govt rescued us: Indian sailor held captive by Houthi rebels
125.article_body: Seven Indian sailors, who were recently released by the Houthi rebels in Yemen, thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for safely bringing them back to India. "The Indian government, our Prime Minister (Narendra Modi), and the Indian embassy rescued us after tough negotiations. We thank them from the bottom of our hearts," one of the rescued sailors said.

126.title: RCB to bowl first against RR, Virat Kohli to open after 2 straight golden ducks
126.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. RCB have made one change to their playing XI, with Rajat Patidar replacing Anuj Rawat. Virat Kohli will open the batting for RCB after getting out for two straight golden ducks batting at number three.

127.title: India's total COVID-19 vaccinations exceed 187.95 crore
127.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) informed that the COVID-19 vaccination coverage in India has exceeded 187.95 crore. Out of the cumulative vaccine coverage, 2,69,76,618 precaution doses have been administered to the ones eligible, informed the ministry. India began its vaccination programme on January 16, 2021.

128.title: BMC conducts health discussions, surveillance activities on World Malaria Day
128.article_body: Mumbai's civic body BMC conducted various awareness activities to combat malaria on World Malaria Day. BMC tweeted, "On the occasion of #WorldMalariaDay, outreach programs and awareness activities like poster displays, rallies, health discussions, surveillance activities and vector control activities were organised by all the departments to combat malaria." BMC plans to eradicate malaria by 2030.

129.title: These places are not just pilgrimages: PM Modi at Sivagiri event
129.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday addressed the inaugural ceremony to mark the 90th anniversary of the Sivagiri pilgrimage in Kerala and golden jubilee of Brahma Vidhyalaya. "These places are not just pilgrimages, they are not just centres of faith, they are awakened establishments of the spirit of 'Ek Bharat, Shreshtha Bharat'," PM Modi stated.

130.title: Possibility of 4th COVID wave extremely low in India: Virologist
130.article_body: Virologist and former Christian Medical College professor Dr T Jacob John said that the probability of a fourth COVID-19 wave in India is extremely low. He added that to his knowledge "no state was reporting a surge in cases." “Delhi and Haryana had minor increase in last two to three weeks but the increase is not being sustained,” he stated.

131.title: Ceasefire in Ukraine war needed immediately: UN chief in Russia
131.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres called for immediate ceasefire in Ukraine invasion at his meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Moscow on Tuesday. Guterres, who will next visit Ukraine, stated that conditions for effective dialogue should be created, adding he wants to reduce impact on food security due to war. He's due to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin today.

132.title: List of IPL's most valuable teams released by Forbes, MI on top
132.article_body: Forbes has released the list of IPL's most valuable teams, with five-time champions MI ranked first with a value of $1.3 billion. CSK ($1.15 billion) are second on the list, followed by KKR ($1.1 billion) and debutants LSG ($1.075 billion). DC complete the top five with $1.035-billion value. GT, who are playing their first season, are last with $850 million.

133.title: Uber faces $19 mn fine over misleading ride cancellation warnings in Aus
133.article_body: Australia's competition watchdog is suing Uber and seeking A$26 million ($19 million) in fine after the ride-sharing app admitted that it misled customers about ride fare estimates and cancellation fees. Between 2017 and 2021, Uber warned users they would be charged fees for cancelling rides even when the cancellation was sought during its 5-minute "free cancellation period", the watchdog said.

134.title: CCTV footage shows female suicide bomber blowing herself up at Karachi University
134.article_body: CCTV footage shows the moment a blast caused by a female suicide bomber ripped through a van inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan. The blast occurred in a van near the gate of the Confucius Institute. Three of those killed are reportedly Chinese nationals and Balochistan Liberation Army has claimed responsibility for the attack.

135.title: Fake kidney donation racket busted in B'luru; 3 foreigners arrested
135.article_body: Bengaluru Police have busted a fake kidney donation racket and arrested three foreign nationals in connection with it. The accused, one from Ghana and two from Nigeria, hosted fake websites and lured donors and recipients by offering up to ₹4 crore, police said. The accused created fake bank accounts but had no money in them, ACP (East) AS Rao said.

136.title: 64,827 Kashmiri Pandit families left Kashmir in 1990s due to militancy: MHA
136.article_body: Over 64,000 Kashmiri Pandit families left Kashmir valley in the early 1990s due to militancy and settled in Jammu, Delhi and other parts of the country, the government has said. According to Ministry of Home Affairs, 14,091 civilians and 5,356 security force personnel lost their lives to militancy in Jammu and Kashmir between the 1990s and 2020.

137.title: Demolition drive begins in Guj's Himmatnagar after Ram Navami violence
137.article_body: A demolition drive was carried out against illegal structures in the Chhapariya locality of Gujarat's Himmatnagar weeks after communal clashes were reported in the city, officials said. Chief Municipal Officer Navneet Patel said, "Bulldozer has been launched by the municipality to remove illegal encroachments." Notably, communal clashes were erupted in the city during the Ram Navami celebration.

138.title: LIC IPO price band likely fixed at ₹902-₹949 per share: Reports
138.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO price band has likely been fixed at ₹902-₹949 per share, reports said on Tuesday. There will be a ₹60 discount for policyholders, the reports added. Previous reports said the LIC IPO will likely open on May 4 and close on May 9, with the government looking to raise ₹21,000 crore by diluting a 3.5% stake.

139.title: Thanks for giving me credit for the term 'multi-alignment': Tharoor to Jaishankar
139.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday posted a selfie with External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar from the Raisina Dialogue 2022 in Delhi. "Thanks for publicly giving me credit for the term 'Multi-alignment' (in the context of India's foreign policy) which I floated 15 years ago," said Tharoor. The term didn't have many takers 15 years ago, Tharoor said.

140.title: Had plans for 'Pirates of the...' ending before I was dropped: Depp
140.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor revealed that he was approached to take part in writing 'Pirates of the Caribbean 6' before he was released by Disney. "There's a way to end a franchise like that...I thought the characters should have a way out, to end the franchise on a very good note," he added.

141.title: Lok Sabha Speaker seeks details of Maha MP Navneet Rana's arrest
141.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has through the Ministry of Home Affairs asked for a "factual note" from the Maharashtra government on the arrest of Amravati MP Navneet Rana. This comes after Rana sent a letter to Birla alleging "inhumane treatment" by the police. Navneet was arrested after she gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside the CM's home.

142.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Transport Bhawan, 4 tenders rushed to spot
142.article_body: A fire broke out in the Transport Bhawan on Parliament Street here on Tuesday, Delhi Fire Services officials said. According to the fire department, a call was received at 4:10 pm and four fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire began from an air-conditioner in one of the rooms of the Transport Bhawan, a senior official said.

143.title: Israel to reopen Gaza border crossing days after rocket attacks
143.article_body: Israel announced on Monday that it'll reopen its border crossing in Gaza Strip to Palestinian workers, days after it closed the point following rocket attacks from the Hamas-controlled area. The opening would be conditioned "on the maintenance of a stable security situation", an Israeli military body said. An estimated 12,000 Palestinians in Gaza cross over to Israel daily for work.

144.title: We're running out of adjectives, superlatives for Buttler: Pietersen
144.article_body: Praising RR opener Jos Buttler for his 65-ball 116 against DC in IPL 2022, Kevin Pietersen said, "We're running out of adjectives and superlatives. IPL is made incredible by...innings like these." He added, "He's such a fine talent and in such a sublime form." With 491 runs from seven matches so far, Buttler is currently the leading scorer in tournament.

145.title: Depp fails to recall his films in court, judge scolds people in courtroom for laughing
145.article_body: Johnny Depp left people laughing in the courtroom after he failed to name his movies in court. According to media reports, Johnny said, "I'm so pathetic when it comes to knowing what movies I've done...I don't watch them." As people laughed in the courtroom, the judge said to everyone, "Order in the court or I'll have you removed."

146.title: B'luru airport registers record growth in cargo volumes in FY 2022
146.article_body: The Kempegowda International airport has recorded its highest-ever cargo tonnage in fiscal year (FY) 2022, the Bengaluru International Airport Limited said. The airport processed 4,11,513 metric tonnes (MT) of cargo in FY 2022, recording a growth of 26% as against 3,26,643 MT in FY 2021. International cargo saw a growth of 31% and domestic cargo grew at 17%, it added.

147.title: 2 pilots try to swap planes at 12,000ft in video, fail as 1 plane nosedives in US
147.article_body: Two US pilots, Luke Aikins and Andy Farrington, trying to swap planes mid-air at 12,000 feet as a stunt failed after one of their planes nosedived. The video of the stunt shows both the pilots diving off the plane and Luke managing to take control of one plane mid-air. Meanwhile, Andy deployed his parachute as the other plane crashed.

148.title: Reliance Industries, UAE-based TA'ZIZ sign $2 billion JV for chemical project
148.article_body:
Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries on Tuesday signed a formal shareholder agreement with Abu Dhabi Chemical Derivatives Company RSC Ltd (TA'ZIZ) for Ruwais Chemicals Project. The shareholder agreement for the over $2 billion TA'ZIZ EDC & PVC joint venture was signed. TA'ZIZ EDC & PVC will produce Chlor-Alkali, Ethylene Dichloride and Polyvinyl Chloride for
the first time in the UAE.

149.title: Blac Chyna slashed Tyga with knife: Kylie Jenner says in court
149.article_body: Television personality Kylie Jenner has testified in court that her partner singer Tyga told her that reality star Blac Chyna slashed his arm with a knife when the two were together. This comes amid Chyna's defamation suit against the Kardashian family for purposefully interfering with her contract on Kylie's brother Rob and Chyna's spin-off of Keeping Up With the Kardashians.

150.title: Trailer looks familiar yet different: Vidya on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
150.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan on Tuesday shared the trailer of film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' on social media, writing, "The trailer looks familiar yet different...Can't wait to experience this roller-coaster ride again." Vidya had portrayed the role of Avni who had dissociative identity disorder and believed herself to be Manjulika in the first film. The sequel stars Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani.

151.title: PM Modi to interact with CMs on COVID-19 situation tomorrow
151.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will interact with Chief Ministers of all states via video conferencing on Wednesday over the prevailing COVID-19 situation in India. This comes as some states and UTs, including Delhi, are reporting a rise in daily COVID-19 cases. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, India reported over 2,000 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

152.title: Police use water cannon to diffuse BJP rally protesting against Mamata govt
152.article_body: West Bengal Police on Tuesday dispersed BJP workers who were taking out a protest rally, led by BJP's Tejasvi Surya against Mamata Banerjee led government in the state with a water cannon. Meanwhile, Tejasvi Surya was on Tuesday asked by the Delhi Police to join the investigation in connection with alleged vandalism at Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence.

153.title: ED raids ABG Shipyard premises in India's biggest bank fraud case: Reports
153.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly carried out raids at 26 premises linked to Mumbai-based ABG Shipyard on Tuesday. The company is accused of defrauding 28 banks of ₹22,842 crore in India's biggest bank fraud case ever. The raids were conducted at multiple premises of ABG Shipyard, its sister companies, as well as executives, in Mumbai, Pune and Surat, reports said.

154.title: Death Of Remakes: RGV on Bollywood remakes of South films
154.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma posted a series of tweets criticising Bollywood remakes of South films with the hashtag #DeathOfRemakes. He wrote if Nani-starrer Telugu film 'Jersey' was dubbed, it would've cost ₹10 lakh, while the Shahid Kapoor-starrer remake cost ₹100 crore which lost "enormous money...and face". "#Pushpa #RRR #KGF2...doing far better than originals if...content is good," he added.

155.title: SEBI attaches Greentouch Projects' assets in illegal fundraising case
155.article_body: Market regulator SEBI has attached 14 properties related to Greentouch Projects and its four directors in an illegal fundraising case to recover ₹56 crore of investors' money. The attached properties include land parcels, plots, office spaces and a flat located in West Bengal and Uttar Pradesh. The company claims to have already repaid over ₹12.24 crore to its investors.

156.title: B'luru Police arrest man for drug peddling, seize drugs worth ₹6.5 lakh
156.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a man for drug peddling in the city and seized drugs estimated to be around ₹6.5 lakh from his possession, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said. The drugs, which have been recovered, include MDMA crystal, ecstasy pills and chassis. Further, a mobile phone, laptop and electronic weighing machine have also been recovered.

157.title: Europe must look beyond Ukraine, world threw Afghanistan under the bus: Jaishankar
157.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while responding to questions on the Russia-Ukraine war from European leaders, said it was a "wake-up call" for Europe to look at pressing issues in other parts of the world. Referring to challenges that Asia is facing, Jaishankar said, "Less than a year ago in Afghanistan...an entire...society was thrown under the bus by the world."

158.title: JNU may be politically charged, but isn't anti-national: VC
158.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said the university may be "politically charged" but it's not "anti-national". "More than 60% of the bureaucracy...is from this very university. Over 90% of the students are apolitical, and they've come here to make a career...[any] negative branding will affect them when they go out to get jobs," Pandit said.

159.title: 2 children among 4 dead after shooting at Russian school: Report
159.article_body: Three individuals, including a teacher and two children, were shot dead after a man opened fire at kindergarten school in Russia's Ulyanovsk region on Tuesday, local authorities told AFP. The accused, whose identity is yet to be revealed, reportedly killed himself after attack. The ages of the dead children would be between 3 and 6 years old, an official said.

160.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey eligible for $978 mn cash payout after Musk's deal: Reports
160.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, who owns a 2.4% stake in the company, is eligible for a $978 million cash payout after Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion, according to reports. According to Musk's deal, he would be buying about 18,042,428 shares of Twitter that are owned by Dorsey for $54.20 each, the reports added.

161.title: Railways must pay compensation if person falls off crowded train: HC
161.article_body: The Bombay High Court said that Railways will have to pay compensation to people who suffer injuries after falling while attempting to board an overcrowded train. The court also directed Western Railways to pay ₹3 lakh to a man who was injured after falling off an overcrowded local train. In 2013, Railway Claims Tribunal had rejected the victim's compensation claim.

162.title: CM KCR lays foundation stone for 3 super-speciality hospitals in Hyd
162.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for three Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences (TIMS) super-speciality hospitals in Hyderabad. The three hospitals, for which the state government has already sanctioned the amount of ₹2,679 crore, will be established at LB Nagar, Sanathnagar and Alwal. Health Minister T Harish Rao and other ministers also accompanied the CM.

163.title: Aren't Hindi films remade in South? Abhishek Bachchan on remakes
163.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, on being asked about Bollywood remakes of South Indian films, said, "Are you telling me...Hindi films aren't...remade in the South?" He further said that films have always been remade and it's not a new phenomenon. "The exchange doesn't happen because there is a dearth of ideas...It is a choice we make as a creator," the actor added.

164.title: Jakhar wishes Congress luck as panel recommends his 2-year suspension
164.article_body: Shortly after the Congress disciplinary panel recommended his two-year suspension on Tuesday, former Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar wished his party good luck. The party's disciplinary committee had on April 11 given a show-cause notice to Jakhar for alleged anti-party activities and sought a reply within a week. He had called former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi a liability.

165.title: Will move heaven & Earth to help Ukraine win battle against Russia: US
165.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin on Tuesday vowed to move "heaven and earth" to "help Ukraine win the fight against Russia's unjust invasion", as allies from 40 nations met to bolster Kyiv's defence against Moscow. Austin added that US and its allies have committed over $5 billion of equipment to support Ukraine's defence since the war began on February 24.

166.title: Ukraine war could be wake-up call for Europe to look at Asia's situation: EAM
166.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the Russia-Ukraine war could be a "wake-up call" for Europe to also look at Asia's situation. "Things have been happening in Asia for the last 10 years. Europe may not have looked at it," he said. It's important to recognise that the "rules-based order has been under continuous stress" in Asia, Jaishankar added.

167.title: More than me Congress needs leadership: Prashant Kishor after declining to join party
167.article_body: After declining to join Congress, poll strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "In my humble opinion, more than me the party needs leadership and collective will to fix the deep rooted structural problems through transformational reforms." He declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group and also to take responsibility for elections.

168.title: Quite surprising: Vettori on PBKS' Rishi Dhawan bowling the final over vs CSK
168.article_body: Reacting to PBKS all-rounder Rishi Dhawan bowling the final over in PBKS' win against CSK, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "I can't imagine...they had planned on giving him the final over, it was quite surprising." Discussing CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 21 off 16 balls, Vettori said Jadeja could have been a "little more" aggressive.

169.title: Ukraine's problems today will be ours tomorrow: Estonian PM amid war
169.article_body: Speaking about Russian invasion of Ukraine, Estonian PM Kaja Kallas said in an interview that Ukraine's problems today will be "our problems tomorrow". Kallas added that countries, including Germany, should adopt a more assertive role in ending the war in Ukraine so as to lessen burden of war refugees. "NATO is a defensive alliance, we're in this together," she added.

170.title: Biden pardons ex-Secret Service agent, reduces sentences for 75 others
170.article_body: US President Joe Biden issued three pardons and 75 prison sentence commutations in his first grants of clemency. All the commutations and two of the three pardons went to people convicted of federal drug offences. The third pardon was given to an 86-year-old ex-US Secret Service agent, Abraham Bolden Sr, who was the first African-American to serve on presidential detail.

171.title: Ranveer dances with Alia to Dholida in BTS video from Gangubai Kathiawadi sets
171.article_body: Ranveer Singh danced with Alia Bhatt on her song 'Dholida' from 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' during the filming of the music video. Saregama Music shared a behind-the-scenes video of the making of the song. Speaking about Dholida in the clip, Ranveer said, "The song is [a] hit." He then performs the hook step of the song with Alia and the background dancers.

172.title: 2 die as wall collapses in Delhi's Keshav Puram, 2nd incident in 24 hrs
172.article_body: Two people died as a wall collapsed in Delhi's Keshav Puram area as the national capital reported a second similar incident in the last 24 hours. "The two persons were rescued from under the debris and rushed to Deep Chand Bandhu Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (northwest) Usha Rangnani.

173.title: Honorarium of mid-day meal cooks increased by the UP Cabinet
173.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government in a meeting chaired by UP CM Yogi Adityanath approved a proposal to raise the honorarium of mid-day meal cooks posted in the state's Basic Education Department. The honorarium of 3,77,520 cooks, engaged in preparing food in the schools under the mid-day meal scheme, has been raised from ₹1,500 to ₹2,000.

174.title: 32.79 lakh foreigners visited India in 2020 despite restrictions: MHA
174.article_body: More than 32.79 lakh foreigners visited India in 2020 despite restrictions, according to a report by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA).
