The maximum number of foreigners who visited India between April 1, 2020, and December 31, 2020, were from the US (61,190). This was followed by people from Bangladesh (37,774), the UK (33,323) and Canada (13,707), the report added.

175.title: Crew was in Ukraine before war, can't contact 3 actors: 'Love in..' director
175.article_body: Filmmaker Nitin Gupta said that the entire crew of his film 'Love in Ukraine' was in Ukraine before the war started and that they are unable to contact three actors now. "Liza, who is also from Ukraine, is stuck somewhere at the Ukraine border and efforts are being made to bring her to India for the film promotions," he added.

176.title: Aarohi came into my life & changed everything: Shraddha on 9 yrs of Aashiqui 2
176.article_body: As her film 'Aashiqui 2' completed nine years of release on Tuesday, actress Shraddha Kapoor said, "Aarohi (her character's name) came into my life, and changed everything." "I am forever grateful and thankful to each and everyone who gave so much love to me as Aarohi," she added. Directed by Mohit Suri, 'Aashiqui 2' also starred Aditya Roy Kapur.

177.title: Ranbir says 'Say hi to my wife' post varmala with Alia, video goes viral
177.article_body: A video of actor Ranbir Kapoor introducing actress Alia Bhatt after their varmala ceremony at their wedding has surfaced online. In the video, Ranbir can be heard saying, "Say hi to my wife." To this, Alia also greeted everyone. Ranbir can be seen kneeling in the video while the varmalas were being exchanged between the two.

178.title: Anil Deshmukh gets clean chit in money laundering case
178.article_body: Chandiwal Commission has given a clean chit to  former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case. The one member high-level enquiry commission was chaired by Justice (retired) Kailash Chandiwal to probe corruption allegations levelled by former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh against Deshmukh. The commission's report was also submitted to CM Uddhav Thackeray.

179.title: Man kills second wife over her 'argumentative nature' in Delhi
179.article_body: A 36-year-old man allegedly killed his second wife in Delhi's Narela area, police said on Monday. The deceased woman was initially raped by her husband's friend and she was later strangulated to death by her husband, police said. According to the police, the accused man said that he was fed up with his wife as she had an argumentative nature.

180.title: Farhan proposed to me for marriage in Maldives; it was unexpected: Shibani
180.article_body: Shibani Dandekar revealed Farhan Akhtar proposed to her for marriage in the Maldives. She said it was "very unexpected." Shibani added she had no idea about it. "We hadn't even discussed it. But this is again Farhan, when he decides something, he does it," she said. Shibani further added she wasn't the kind of person who wanted to get married.

181.title: Was there nothing better to do with $44 billion: Simu on Musk's Twitter takeover
181.article_body: Hollywood celebrities reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal. Shang-Chi actor, Simu Liu tweeted, "Was there nothing better to do with 44 billion dollars?" Priyanka Chopra's brother-in-law, singer Kevin Jonas wrote, "Will we now get the edit tweet option?" In a joint statement with Twitter, Musk said that he wants to make the Twitter service "better than ever".

182.title: SC agrees to list pleas challenging K'taka HC's hijab ban in educational institutions
182.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to list appeals challenging the Karnataka High Court order upholding the hijab ban in educational institutions. CJI NV Ramana asked senior advocate Meenakshi Arora to "wait for two days" when she mentioned the matter and said that he will list it soon. CJI Ramana has also urged parties not to sensationalise the matter.

183.title: Didn't want them without purpose: 'Bhool...' maker on not casting Akshay, Vidya
183.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, while speaking about not casting Vidya Balan and Akshay Kumar in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said, "The script didn't give us the liberty to bring them onboard." "We didn't want to bring the two onboard without any purpose...This story did not permit us to bring them," he added. The upcoming film stars Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani and Tabu.

184.title: So many roles and genres still haven't come my way: Saif Ali Khan
184.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that there are several roles and genres that have not come his way. However, he added, "It's not really about the genre. It's about doing the same thing differently and doing it better." "So, even the roles that I've...done, I think I would approach them differently [if I do them now]," Saif further stated.

185.title: I felt a 'blinding hurt': Depp on reading ex-wife Amber Heard's op-ed
185.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp said he felt a "blinding hurt" after reading ex-wife Amber Heard's op-ed which claimed that Heard was a victim of domestic violence. "It was like somebody had hit me in the back of the head with a 2x4," added Depp. Depp has sued Heard for defamation over her op-ed which was written in 2018.

186.title: Aus, NZ decide not to send athletes for this year's Asian Games
186.article_body: Australia will not be sending its athletes to the Asian Games for the first time this year and similarly, New Zealand has confirmed that their athletes too won't be going to Hangzhou in September this year. Notably, the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) had invited a quota of around 450 contingent members from Oceania nations, including Australia and New Zealand.

187.title: Tibetans being forced to speak Chinese: Report
187.article_body: Officials from China are forcing people in rural Tibet to speak in Chinese, a report said. It is part of China's campaign to restrict Tibetans from using their native languages, it added. A 10-day workshop was reportedly conducted in Kongpo to promote Chinese as the main language of communication. The local administrators were asked to conduct business only in Chinese.

188.title: Cancer patient posts pic of him giving interview amid treatment, gets hired
188.article_body: A cancer patient's post on recruiters rejecting him due to the disease has gone viral. Posting a picture of him giving an interview amid chemo, Arsh Prasad said, "I don't need...sympathy! I'm here to prove myself." Applied Cloud Computing CEO Nilesh Satpute commented, "Please stop attending interviews...I checked your credentials, they're very strong. You can join us...There'll be no interview."

189.title: Disney rejects Saudi's demand to cut LGBT scene in Doctor Strange 2
189.article_body: Disney has refused Saudi Arabia's demand to cut same-sex relationship references from 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. A Saudi official stated that the film will never be banned in the country but they are still negotiating with Disney. Earlier, Warner Bros had been criticised for cutting same-sex romance references in 'Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore' for China.

190.title: TN man gets death penalty for beheading minor Dalit girl for rejecting advances
190.article_body: A court in Tamil Nadu awarded death sentence to a 26-year-old man for beheading a minor Dalit girl for allegedly rejecting his sexual advances. The incident occurred on October 22, 2018, when the accused, identified as Dinesh Kumar, barged into the house of the 14-year-old victim and killed her. The accused had also attacked the girl's mother.

191.title: My intro in 'Parinda' is one of the world's 'worst' performances: Anil
191.article_body: Discussing his 1989 film 'Parinda', actor Anil Kapoor said, "My introduction [sequence]...is one of the worst performances in the world. I want to reshoot it." "I was being my full-on self," added Anil. 'Parinda' also starred actor Jackie Shroff who had earlier revealed that he slapped Anil 17 times for a scene in the film.

192.title: 6th round of sanctions against Russia expected very soon: EU
192.article_body: The European Union's energy policy chief Kadri Simson said a sixth package of sanctions against Russia over Ukraine invasion is expected "very soon". Reportedly, the sixth package may include some form of oil embargo. In its previous packages, the 27-nation bloc had backed a ban on coal and removed a number of Russian banks from the SWIFT financial system.

193.title: Human Rights Watch head to step down after nearly 3 decades
193.article_body: Human Rights Watch (HRW) Executive Director Kenneth Roth said he'd step down at the end of August after running the global rights watchdog for nearly three decades. "Under Roth's leadership, HRW grew from a staff of about 60 with a $7 million budget to 552 covering over 100 countries and a nearly $100 million budget," the New York-based group said.

194.title: I've grown up watching Akshay, it's better not to compare: Kartik on 'Bhool..'
194.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that it is better to not compare him with Akshay Kumar in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "I can't compare because it's too big a shoe to fill. I had loved him in Bhool Bhulaiyaa 1, and have grown up watching him...Comparisons will happen...but I hope 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' will be remembered as a new film," he added.

195.title: Was aware of CSK's plan to bowl wide yorkers at me: Dhawan
195.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 88(59) against CSK on Monday, Punjab Kings batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he was aware of CSK bowlers' plan "to bowl wide yorkers" at him. "During my innings, I had in my mind intentions to attack the shorter side of the field, though not a specific bowler...I was aware of their plans," Dhawan said.

196.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar; 9 fire tenders on spot
196.article_body: A fire broke out in the Amar Colony area of Delhi's Lajpat Nagar on Tuesday afternoon, ANI reported. Following the incident, around nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the flames. A video shared by ANI showed smoke billowing out of the building in Amar Colony. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident so far.

197.title: Gujarat policeman arrested for taking ₹2 lakh bribe in Gurugram
197.article_body: A police inspector, Jagdish Chaudhary, of the Gujarat Police was caught red-handed accepting a bribe of ₹2 lakh from a Gurugram resident in Sector 49 on Sunday, officials said on Monday. Chaudhary had given an assurance to weaken a cheating case against the complainant's nephew, according to officials. Chaudhary had accepted ₹1 lakh from the complainant on April 12.

198.title: Mumbai Police video shows MP-MLA couple having tea in custody after ill-treatment claim
198.article_body: After Amravati MP Navneet Rana alleged "inhumane treatment" by police, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey shared a video showing Navneet and her husband MLA Ravi Rana having tea in the Khar Police Station. "Do we say anything more," the Police chief captioned the video. Meanwhile, the Union Home Ministry has sought a factual report from Maharashtra government over Navneet's allegation.

199.title: Section 144 imposed in Maharashtra's Aurangabad ahead of Raj Thackeray's rally
199.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray's rally on May 1. Restrictions will remain in force in the district till May 9. Thackeray had earlier announced the rally to protest against the recital of 'azaan' from loudspeakers at mosques and had demanded the removal of these loudspeakers by May 3.

200.title: People took me more seriously after 'Dil Dhadakne Do': Pawan Chopra
200.article_body: Actor Pawan Chopra said people started taking him more "seriously" after his performance in the film 'Dil Dhadakne Do', which also starred Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma. "Filmmakers now have the conviction that I can pull off any character," added Pawan. Pawan stated that he started working in films as it was not exciting playing the same roles in television shows.

201.title: Depp's a huge narcissist, he was overacting during the trial: Howard Stern
201.article_body: Discussing actor Johnny Depp's ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, American radio personality Howard Stern said, "The reason he wanted...it televised [is because] that's what narcissists do." "Depp is a huge narcissist," added Stern. "I will play you some clips from the...trial. Depp's so overacting because he's writing his own material as he goes along," stated Stern.

202.title: Operation Romeo's Sidhant to star in Vikramaditya's series on film industry
202.article_body: Sidhant Gupta, who was most recently seen in the film 'Operation Romeo', has reportedly teamed up with filmmaker Vikramaditya Motwane for a new series, tentatively titled 'Stardust'. According to reports, the eight-episode series is inspired by true events and will highlight the work culture of the film industry. The makers are planning to release the show this year, reports stated.

203.title: Usyk to raise funds for Ukraine through his bout against Joshua: Report
203.article_body: Olympic gold medallist boxer Oleksandr Usyk will raise relief funds for his native Ukraine through his bout against UK's Anthony Joshua which is expected to be held later this year. "Many people in Ukraine are now seeking help. We think that as soon as it's released, many people will actually receive this help," the unified heavyweight champion told Reuters.

204.title: Maharashtra's peak power demand met successfully: Electricity board
204.article_body: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) said that it met the state's peak power demand of the season amid rising demand and further avoided load shedding. "On Sunday, MSEDCL provided 26,468 MV without any load shedding in the state," an official release added. "Also, on Monday, there was no load shedding across the state," MSEDCL stated.

205.title: Extremists suspected to have infiltrated Canadian military: Report
205.article_body: Violent extremists such as the white supremacists are suspected to have infiltrated the Canadian Armed Forces and the military isn't doing enough to prevent it, a report released by Defence Minister Anita Anand said. It said that the efforts to detect the extremists were inefficient and the infiltrators were adept at avoiding getting caught.

206.title: Blast at Karachi University, 3 Chinese nationals among 4 reportedly killed
206.article_body: At least four people were killed and several others were injured in a blast that occurred inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan, reports said. Three of those killed are reportedly Chinese nationals, they added. The blast took place at around 2 pm in a van near Confucius Institute, reports said.

207.title: Twinkle Khanna's short story Salaam Noni Appa to be made into a film
207.article_body: A new movie based on Twinkle Khanna's short story 'Salaam Noni Appa' from her 2016 anthology 'The Legend of Lakshmi Prasad' is in the works. The yet-untitled film will be jointly produced by Applause Entertainment, Ellipsis Entertainment and Twinkle's Mrs Funnybones Movies. Twinkle said that the short story 'Salaam Noni Appa' is loosely based on her grandmother and her sister.

208.title: We aren't getting good starts in first 6 overs: Jadeja on CSK's 6th loss
208.article_body: Following CSK's sixth defeat in IPL 2022 after losing to PBKS by 11 runs on Monday, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said his side is lacking in getting good starts in the first six overs this season. Chasing 188-run target, CSK were reduced to 40/3 after seven overs. "Hopefully we'll come back stronger," he added. CSK are currently ninth in standings.

209.title: Mumbai Police filed fake FIR in my name: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya
209.article_body: Former BJP MP Kirit Somaiya on Tuesday claimed that a fake FIR was filed in his name at Khar Police Station in Mumbai which he had not even signed. Somaiya criticised Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey over the issue and also claimed that Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray had sent some "goons" to attack him.

210.title: Arrange Ayodhya trips for Pune residents: Patil to ex-corporators
210.article_body:
Ahead of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) elections, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil
has urged ex-corporators to maintain a "public connect" with people. Patil added that the former corporators should arrange trips to Ayodhya for the residents, where construction of the Ram Mandir is underway. "[BJP] can win PMC elections when the organisation is alive and powerful," he added.

211.title: Cong panel recommends ex-Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar's suspension for 2 yrs
211.article_body: The Congress disciplinary committee on Tuesday recommended suspension of its former Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar from the organisation for two years over anti-party activities. The panel has also recommended that veteran party leader from Kerala, KV Thomas, be removed from all party posts. The final call on the panel's recommendations will be taken by Congress President Sonia Gandhi.

212.title: Prashant Kishor declines offer to join Congress
212.article_body: Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala on Tuesday announced that poll strategist Prashant Kishor has declined Congress' offer to join the party. ''Following a presentation & discussions with Sh Prashant Kishor, Congress President has constituted an Empowered Action Group 2024 & invited him to join the party as part of the group with defined responsibility. He declined," he tweeted.

213.title: Suriya donates vehicle worth ₹6 lakh to Tamil Nadu police department
213.article_body: Actor Suriya's production house donated a vehicle worth ₹6 lakh to the Tamil Nadu police department's 'Kaval Karangal' initiative. The 'Kaval Karangal' initiative has been launched by the Tamil Nadu Police with the aim of providing help to needy people. Reportedly the vehicle donated by the actor's production house would be used to deliver food to the homeless people.

214.title: Today, actors decide if film is hit, give money to Insta friends: Nawazuddin
214.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said only streaming platforms can know if a film is a hit or a flop. "But today...even actors...decide if their film is hit or flop...They have four friends on Instagram. They pay money to them [for posts]," he said, adding he doubts if English-speaking actors will be able to do justice to gangster series.

215.title: China rejects speculation it may try to influence Twitter after Musk's deal
215.article_body: Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin has rejected the speculation that Beijing could try to use leverage over Tesla in order to influence Twitter. This came after Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. Following the deal, Amazon's Jeff Bezos had tweeted, "Did the Chinese government just gain a bit of leverage over the town square?"

216.title: In a first since 2020, Andhra reported 0 COVID cases in a day
216.article_body: Andhra Pradesh reported zero COVID-19 cases on Monday, making it the first time since March 2020 that such a feat was achieved by the state. However, there are still 22 active COVID-19 cases in the state. Notably, the Visakha Institute of Medical Sciences is the only institute in the state to host nasal COVID-19 vaccine trials.

217.title: 2 women killed as mine collapses in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri
217.article_body: At least two women were killed after a mine collapsed while they were digging out its soil in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district on Monday evening, police said. The incident took place near a canal of the Sular river, police added. While digging, they went deep into the cave-shaped mine which later collapsed on them, police further said.

218.title: 3 Kashmiri students, charged with sedition, get out of Agra jail
218.article_body: Three Kashmiri students, who were charged with sedition for allegedly cheering for Pakistan in a T20 World Cup match, were released from Agra jail on Monday. They were stuck in jail despite being granted bail by Allahabad High Court nearly a month ago for want of guarantors. Earlier, a relative of an accused had expressed inability to pay surety deposit.

219.title: Olympic snowboarding champion Chloe Kim to take break for mental health
219.article_body: Double Olympic snowboarding champion Chloe Kim said that she will skip the 2022-23 season to focus on her mental health. "Just want to kind of reset...don't want to get right back into it after such a fun, but draining year, at the same time," said the 22-year-old American snowboarder. Kim has previously taken a break after the 2018 Winter Games.

220.title: Bengaluru Police solves ₹1 crore robbery case using FASTag details
220.article_body: The Bengaluru Police has solved a ₹1 crore robbery case using FASTag details of the accused's car and arrested ten members of the Kerala gang. The accused reportedly attacked a vehicle carrying five employees of a private finance firm and looted their money. They kept changing the number plate of the car but were later tracked with their FASTag details.

221.title: Zayed Khan shares pics of his transformation, calls Hrithik Roshan his mentor
221.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan took to Instagram to share pictures from a photoshoot and spoke about his "transformative journey". "Every 5 days I will share a new array of pictures that exposes the transformed 'Zayed Khan'," he wrote. Zayed also thanked his family members along with "brother and mentor" Hrithik Roshan, further thanking fitness trainer Satyajit Chourasia.

222.title: Virat Kohli texted me 'Lottery lag gayi bhai': Harshal on RCB buying him for ₹10.75 crore
222.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel revealed that after RCB bought him for ₹10.75 crore at the IPL mega auction, Virat Kohli texted him, "Lottery lag gayi bhai." Harshal added, "I replied, 'Haan bhai lag gayi. Way beyond my expectations'." Harshal added, "Money is great but for me the central goal of my life is freedom."

223.title: 3-4 people from IPL teams said they'll bid for me but didn't: Harshal on 2018 auction
223.article_body: Referring to IPL 2018 auction wherein he was bought at his base price by DC, RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel revealed that three to four people from several franchises had told him that they will bid for him but didn't. "It felt like betrayal. [I felt like] 'They lied to me, I have been misled'," Harshal said.

224.title: Taiwan to include lessons from Russia-Ukraine war in military drills
224.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said the island will incorporate lessons learned from the Russian invasion of Ukraine into upcoming military exercises. This year's Han Kuang exercises, Taiwan's largest annual war games, are aimed at practising fighting off a Chinese attack, it added. Taiwan has raised its alert level since the invasion. China claims democratically governed Taiwan as its own territory.

225.title: Karunanidhi's birthday to be celebrated as govt function in TN: CM Stalin
225.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Tuesday that late DMK supremo and ex-CM M Karunanidhi's birth anniversary (June 3) will henceforth be marked as a government function. Stalin, who is Karunanidhi's son, added that stalwart's statue will be unveiled at Chennai's Omandurar estate. Karunanidhi, a five-time CM, had never lost an election in his life, Stalin also pointed out.

226.title: Uttarakhand CM visits Kedarnath to review Yatra related preparations
226.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami visited Kedarnath on Tuesday to review Kedarnath Yatra-related preparations. "This year, hotels, cabs, taxis etc are being booked two months prior, hence, we are expecting it to break all records this time," the CM said. According to the announcement at Omkareshwar Temple, the portals of Kedarnath Temple will open for public on May 6.

227.title: Tesla welcome to India, but it must not import cars from China: Gadkari
227.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said that electric carmaker Tesla is welcome to set up shop in India, make cars for sale and export them, but the company must not import cars from China. "Making in China and selling here is not a good proposition," Gadkari said. Tesla has been working for a year to get tax breaks from India.

228.title: 2 men tried to remove my clothes and rape me inside college washroom: UP student
228.article_body: A BSc student in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj has said that she was molested by two men in her college's washroom. "The two men were wearing face masks so I couldn't recognise them but I had bitten one of the accused's hand. They even tried to remove my clothes and rape me but I somehow managed the escape," she added.

229.title: Shibani's vibrancy brought balance in our marriage: Farhan Akhtar
229.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar, speaking about his wife Shibani Dandekar, has said that a "certain vibrancy" about the actress was something he found attractive. "While I'm the non-talker, Shibani can talk to anyone and anything! Even a tree," he added. "It brought in...a sweet balance in our relationship, now marriage," he said. The duo tied the knot on February 19.

230.title: UP govt to set up 2 new police stations in Lucknow Police Commissionerate
230.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday said two new police stations will be set up in the Lucknow Police Commissionerate. This will help in strengthening law and order and provide easy availability of police services to the general public, the Chief Minister's Office tweeted. The government will set up the new police stations at Madehganj and Dubagga.

231.title: It changes equation between two people: Pulkit on marriage plans with Kriti
231.article_body: When asked about his wedding plans with his girlfriend, actress Kriti Kharbanda, actor Pulkit Samrat said, "My funda is simple, as long as you are living as best friends things are sorted. Your arguments and love are all friendly." "When it comes to marriage, it tends to sometimes change this equation between the two individuals," he added.

232.title: Hopeful Moeen recovers from ankle injury in 7 days: CSK head coach Fleming
232.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said he's hopeful that team's all-rounder Moeen Ali, who hurt his ankle in the training session on Saturday, will make a quick recovery in a week's time as there is no fracture. Moeen missed Monday's match against PBKS in IPL 2022. He has scored 87 runs and has gone wicketless in five matches so far.

233.title: Ukraine can win war with Russia: US
233.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin began defence talks with over 40 countries on Tuesday by saying that Ukraine can prevail against Russia in the two-month-old conflict. "Ukraine clearly believes that it can win, and so does everyone here," he said. "Your resistance has brought inspiration to the free world," Austin further said.

234.title: Couldn't refuse projects with seniors, felt why take panga? Shreyas
234.article_body: Actor Shreyas Talpade has revealed that he was offered films by some seniors and known banners but he couldn't say no since he was new in the industry. "You feel why take any panga (trouble) because they'll feel bad if you turn down their projects," he added. Shreyas further said things changed for him after doing 'Apna Sapna Money Money'.

235.title: 17-yr-old Tripura girl, boyfriend die by suicide after being summoned by police
235.article_body: A 17-year-old girl and her 21-year-old boyfriend allegedly died by suicide after they were summoned to a police station in Tripura's Gomati district, an officer said. The summons came after a complaint was lodged by the girl's father, who claimed that his daughter had been abducted. The couple took the step after anticipating trouble, the officer added.

236.title: Shammi Kapoor didn't marry Mumtaz, he wanted someone to look after kids: Son
236.article_body: Late veteran actor Shammi Kapoor's son Aditya has spoken about the former's affair with actress Mumtaz, saying "the meeting of minds didn't happen". He added Shammi wanted someone to look after his kids while Mumtaz was close to signing a film with Rajesh Khanna. "I don't think Dad was wrong...I don't think Mumtazji was wrong either...to concentrate on...career," Aditya said.

237.title: Neighbour slashes woman's throat over water dispute in south Delhi
237.article_body: A 48-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her neighbour on Tuesday after a dispute over fetching water at the Dalit Ekta camp in south Delhi's Vasant Kunj area. Arjun (the accused) slashed Shyam Kala's (the victim) throat with a knife, causing her instant death. Kala's son said Arjun attacked him and his father as well when they tried to intervene.

238.title: SDMC orders probe in Delhi building collapse, says building was 'unsafe'
238.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor Mukesh Suryan has ordered an investigation after a building undergoing renovation collapsed in the Satya Niketan area on Monday, killing two labourers. Suryan said that the building was "unsafe" and they had earlier warned its owner against carrying out the renovation works. "It seems like illegal construction was going on in the building," he added.

239.title: Noida Police arrest 3 members of gang stealing two-wheelers in NCR
239.article_body: Noida Police on Monday said that three members of a gang involved in stealing two-wheelers in the NCR region have been arrested. The police also said that they've recovered 28 two-wheelers and also impounded a truck used by the gang to transport the stolen vehicles. The gang used to sell the stolen bikes in parts to scrap dealers, they added.

240.title: You got Twitter out of an impossible situation: Dorsey to Musk, Parag
240.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey thanked Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal and Elon Musk after Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for about $44 billion. "Thank you both for getting the company out of an impossible situation," tweeted Dorsey. He further said that both Musk and Agrawal have a goal of creating a platform that is "maximally trusted and broadly inclusive".

241.title: 'I also have no light' tweets Goa Electricity Dept; chat with users goes viral
241.article_body: Goa Electricity Department tweeted about power cuts and wrote, "I also have no lights and would be anytime fading away from you all until supply is restored." "I'm also a consumer like you, now out of office but only a dept person on twitter. No special service to me," it responded to a user. The tweets have now been deleted.

242.title: 5, including 2 children, killed as car crashes into truck in Maharashtra
242.article_body: As many as five persons, including two children, were killed and four others were seriously injured when the car they were travelling in crashed into a stationary truck in Maharashtra's Solapur on Monday, officials said. The victims, residents of Miraj, were on their way to Karnataka's Hubli, officials added. The car was moving at a very high speed, officials stated.

243.title: Emmy-winning actress Jean Smart honoured with star on H'wood Walk of Fame
243.article_body: Multiple Primetime Emmy Award-winning actress Jean Smart has become the latest celebrity to get a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 70-year-old actress, known for shows like 'Fargo' and 'Mare of Easttown', was honoured with a star on April 25. "We're proud to add her distinguished name to...Hollywood Walk of Fame," stated Ana Martinez, Hollywood Walk of Fame Producer.

244.title: Akshay should play father with younger actor as son in 'Waqt...' remake: Vipul
244.article_body: 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' director Vipul Shah said that if actor Akshay Kumar is ready for a remake of the film, he should play the father's role and a younger actor should be cast as the son. Vipul added that Akshay has a soft spot for father-son stories because he was very close to his father.

245.title: Upset with attitude of Cong disciplinary committee: Sunil Jakhar
245.article_body: After being issued a show-cause notice by the Congress disciplinary committee, senior Punjab Congress leader Sunil Jakhar has said that he is angry and upset with the attitude of the committee. "For years, I have acted as a disciplined worker of the Congress party," Jakhar, who has been summoned for allegedly making controversial statements against the party leaders, said.

246.title: Saudi PIF head committed to take Tesla private with me: Musk
246.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a news channel discussing texts between Saudi PIF and him, saying, "The head of Saudi PIF committed unequivocally to take Tesla private with me, as witnessed by...Tesla CFO and several others." The channel said the texts "confirm they were serious about taking Tesla private". "That is why I said funding was secured," Musk added.

247.title: Ameesha Patel accused of cheating, actress says she 'feared for her life' at MP event
247.article_body: A police complaint has been lodged against Ameesha Patel over alleged cheating. According to the complaint, she staged an "extremely brief performance" at an event in Madhya Pradesh. Ameesha had allegedly charged around ₹4 lakh for one hour's performance but performed for only 3 minutes. However,  Ameesha tweeted the event was badly organised and that she "feared for her life".

248.title: India creates world record for waving 78,000 national flags simultaneously
248.article_body: India has entered the Guinness Book of World Records for the simultaneous waving of national flags, breaking Pakistan's record created 18 years ago in the same activity. Over 78,000 people waved the Tricolour simultaneously at an event, setting the record in Bihar on April 23. Home Minister Amit Shah participated in the event and also waved the Tricolour.

249.title: Pune's 1st heart transplant of the year saves life of 59-yr-old man
249.article_body: The first heart transplant in Pune this year was performed on Monday at Sahyadri Hospital after a medical team transported the organ from Kolhapur within two-and-a-half hours via green corridor. The liver and kidneys of 25-year-old donor, whose heart was transplanted into a 59-year-old veterinary doctor, were also donated to other hospitals. The receiver was suffering from end-stage heart failure.

250.title: Everything happened as per plan, Punjab way is attacking way: Bhanuka Rajapaksa
250.article_body: PBKS' Bhanuka Rajapaksa has said everything happened as per their plan as they defeated CSK by 11 runs in their match on Monday. "It was not the greatest wicket to bat on when we started. We had a shorter side, so we knew what we had to do. We had a plan...the Punjab way is the attacking way," he stated.

251.title: MP govt to give ₹900/month to farmers rearing indigenous cows: CM
251.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday said that farmers who rear indigenous cows will be given ₹900/month, which will amount to ₹10,800/year. Chouhan, who was addressing a NITI Aayog workshop, also announced the formation of a board to promote natural farming. "Desi (indigenous) cows are essential for natural farming…Farmers should rear at least one desi cow," he added.

252.title: Rapper Bad Bunny to play Spider-Man character El Muerto in standalone movie
252.article_body: Puerto Rican rapper Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio, professionally known as Bad Bunny, has been roped in to essay the role of Marvel hero El Muerto in a standalone film. El Muerto, known as Juan-Carlos Estrada Sanchez in the comics, is a super-powered wrestler who fought Spider-Man in a charity wrestling match. The film will reportedly release on January 12, 2024.

253.title: UK drops tariffs on all goods from Ukraine to help its economy
253.article_body: Following a direct request from Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, the UK has dropped tariffs on goods coming from Ukraine. The move would provide "much-needed economic support" to Ukraine, UK government said. "The UK will continue to do everything in its power to support Ukraine's fight against [Vladimir] Putin's brutal...invasion," UK International Trade Secretary Anne-Marie Trevelyan said.

254.title: Police to question Tejasvi Surya over attack on Kejriwal's house
254.article_body: Delhi Police has asked BJP MP Tejasvi Surya to join the investigation into the recent attack on CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence. The investigating officer has called Surya, who is also Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) chief, for questioning on April 28 at Civil Lines police station, according to police. Surya has reportedly agreed to join the probe.

255.title: Alphonso mango supply crosses 70,000 boxes at Mumbai's Vashi market
255.article_body: The Agricultural Produce Market Committee (APMC) received highest lot of Alphonso mangoes of over 72,000 boxes on Monday. Market will continue to receive good quantity of mangoes till May 15, traders at APMC said. Farmers are sending mangoes which are almost ready without checking supply and demand status, an APMC official said. They want to recover their investment, he added.

256.title: 32 more test COVID-19 positive at IIT Madras campus; tally rises to 111
256.article_body: At least 32 more persons tested COVID-19 positive at IIT Madras campus in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases to 111. "During inspection, we found that people from 13 districts and one from abroad had stayed at a particular hostel. Through that one person, the virus spread to other departments and hostels," state Health Secretary said.

257.title: Pics from 66-year-old ex-India cricketer Arun Lal's haldi ceremony surface
257.article_body: Pictures from 66-year-old former India cricketer Arun Lal's haldi ceremony have surfaced online. Arun Lal will get married to 38-year-old Bul Bul Saha in Kolkata on May 2. Bul Bul is a school teacher by profession. Arun Lal is currently the head coach of Bengal cricket team. The duo had reportedly got engaged last month.

258.title: Musk likes a cartoon about him on 'setting the blue bird free'
258.article_body: Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, liked a cartoon on Twitter about the acquisition. "Elon Musk has finally set the blue bird free," the tweet accompanying the cartoon read. "Free speech is the bedrock of a functioning democracy, and Twitter is the digital town square where matters vital to the future of humanity are debated," Musk has said.

259.title: 80-year-old beggar woman donates ₹1 lakh to temple in Karnataka
259.article_body: An 80-year-old woman who has been begging near temples during festivals for the last 18 years after her husband passed away, donated ₹1 lakh to Sri Kshethra Rajarajeshwari Temple in Karnataka. Ashwathamma from Udupi got the money by collecting alms for about a month in front of the same temple. She has donated money to other temples as well.

260.title: Will Smith is a sweetheart; sometimes things happen: AR Rahman on slap incident
260.article_body: AR Rahman reacted to Will Smith's Oscar slap incident on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. The composer-singer was shown a picture of himself with Will Smith. While the photo was old, a few comments on it were made post the Oscar incident. Sharing his experience of meeting Will Smith, AR Rahman said, "He is a sweetheart," adding, "Sometimes such things happen."

261.title: Adani in advanced talks to buy Holcim's majority stake in Ambuja: Report
261.article_body: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group is in advanced talks to acquire Holcim Ltd's businesses in India, Bloomberg reported. Adani could sign a deal to buy a controlling stake in Ambuja Cements from Holcim in the coming days, Bloomberg added. Holcim, the world's largest cement maker, currently owns 63.1% stake in Ambuja, which has a market value of about $10 billion.

262.title: Ambati Rayudu's hand was bruising: Fleming on Rayudu's 78(39)
262.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming has revealed that Ambati Rayudu got injured while fielding in the first innings against PBKS and was in pain during his 78-run innings. "Rayudu's hand was bruising...It was the same hand that was broken sometime back, so it's still pretty tender and a knock like that can obviously cause some damage," added Fleming.

263.title: Russia fines Meta for not deleting 'LGBT propaganda' post: Report
263.article_body: A Russian court has fined Meta four million roubles ($54,030) for failing to delete posts containing "LGBT propaganda", news agency Interfax reported. As per Russian law, "promotion of non-traditional sexual relations to minors" is prohibited. Last month, Russian communications regulator said it drew up two administrative cases against Google for failing to remove banned content from YouTube.

264.title: PMC warns against submission of incorrect docs for COVID-19 claims
264.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has asked people to submit correct documents for claiming COVID-19 compensation as they would otherwise face legal action, a senior health officer at the civic body said. The officer added that the PMC has received 16,000 claims, of which 2,000 have been cleared. The Centre has announced a ₹50,000 compensation to kin of each COVID-19 victim.

265.title: Hope central leaders find way so that I continue to remain in Cong: Hardik Patel
265.article_body: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Tuesday said he is currently with the party and "hoped" that the central leaders find a way so that he continues to remain in the Congress. "I am in Congress currently...There are others who want Hardik to leave Congress. They want to break my morale," Patel tweeted.

266.title: Electricity crisis in UP likely to worsen due to coal shortage: Govt officials
266.article_body: The electricity crisis in Uttar Pradesh is likely to worsen as the coal stock backup for thermal power plants was in the "critical" and "super-critical" range as of April 22, months ahead of monsoon, state energy department officials said. Officials attributed the coal shortage to lesser supply from coal companies due to shortage of wagons for ferrying coal to plants.

267.title: Vivek joins Shilpa, Sidharth in Rohit Shetty's cop series Indian Police Force
267.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi has joined actors Shilpa Shetty and Sidharth Malhotra in the Rohit Shetty's cop series 'Indian Police Force'. Taking to Twitter, Vivek made an official announcement that he has joined hands with Rohit in his cop universe. Sharing a picture of himself as a police officer, Vivek wrote, "Thank you...Rohit Shetty for trusting me with this amazing role!"

268.title: Musk hasn't backed projects that aren't game-changers: Ukraine Vice PM
268.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal saying, "Over the past decades, Elon Musk has not invested in projects that are not the game-changers of the industry." He added that he is sure an "unexpected turn in the development of social media" is on its way.

269.title: Temple, mosque in UP's Jhansi remove loudspeakers to promote harmony
269.article_body: A temple and mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi, which are located near each other, have taken down their loudspeakers to promote communal harmony. "The bhajans (prayers) are being recited regularly but without loudspeakers," the temple's priest said. The mosque's imam said, "We have been living in harmony and this (loudspeakers) cannot be allowed to come in the way."

270.title: Upset over being sacked, man sets woman ablaze in Pune; dies himself
270.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Milind Nathsagar, who set a 32-year old woman, Bala Janind, on fire after allegedly being sacked by her from her tailoring shop, died of burn injuries himself in Pune. While the woman sustained 90 per cent burn injuries in the incident, another person who tried to intervene has sustained 35 per cent burn injuries.

271.title: He's the best death bowler in IPL 2022: Rabada on Arshdeep Singh
271.article_body: PBKS pacer Kagiso Rabada has praised his teammate pacer Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old is the "best death bowler" in the ongoing tournament. "Arshdeep has got a lot of talent, drive and ambition...So, nice to have him around. I know I'm going to bowl at the death...[but] he has been leading the way in that discipline," stated Rabada.

272.title: I am a child of war, know what it's like to lose close people: Djokovic
272.article_body: Discussing the sanctions imposed on Russian and Belarusian athletes, Novak Djokovic said, "I grew up with sanctions. I know how it feels when the world sees you differently because a bad image has been created." "I am a child of war...[and] know what it is like to lose close people. I will be against it forever," added Djokovic.

273.title: Over 45 cr people lost hope of getting job due to PM's 'masterstrokes': Rahul
273.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday alleged that over 45 crore people have lost hope of getting a job due to PM Modi's 'masterstrokes'. "New India's new slogan - har ghar berozegaari, ghar ghar berozegaari (there is unemployment in every household)," he tweeted. Rahul also cited a news report that claimed 2.1 crore jobs were lost in last five years.

274.title: PMPML to start electric bus service at Pune's Sinhagad Fort from May 1
274.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has decided to start its electric bus service at Sinhagad Fort ghat section from May 1. "There is a charging point at the bottom of the fort. Parking space is also available for buses. People will be able to take the bus from here to the fort," the PMPML chairman said.

275.title: Indian healthcare sector becoming affordable, accessible for everyone: Mandaviya
275.article_body: The Indian healthcare sector is becoming affordable and accessible for everyone, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Monday at the inauguration of the 7th edition of the International Conference on Pharma and Medical Devices sector. "Government has been working relentlessly to increase the number of doctors, medical institutions and health infrastructure," Mandaviya added.

276.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' team apologises over wrong year of Lata Mangeshkar's song
276.article_body: After the 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' team went on to air an incorrect fact about Lata Mangeshkar's 'Aye Mere Watan Ke Logo', it apologised in a post on Twitter. "We inadvertently mentioned 1965 as the year of release of the song. However, we would like to correct ourselves. The song was released on 26th Jan, 1963," it said.

277.title: Told the boys if one single 'F**k you comes your way, give them 3 back': Ravi Shastri
277.article_body: Talking about becoming Team India's director in 2014, Ravi Shastri said that he wanted the team to be aggressive and ruthless. "It was about attitude, especially when playing against Australians," he added. Shastri stated, "I told the boys if one single 'F**k you’ comes your way, give them three back: two in our language and one in theirs."

278.title: Cristiano Ronaldo leaving Man Utd didn't impact the club: Gary Neville
278.article_body: Ex-Manchester United player Gary Neville said Cristiano Ronaldo's transfer from Manchester United to Real Madrid in 2009 "did not" have an impact on the club, as there was no speculation. "Everyone knew what was happening," added Neville. Ronaldo joined Real Madrid for £80 million scoring 451 goals in 438 matches. Ronaldo scored 118 goals for United from 2003 to 2009.

279.title: Unique incident in India's history: Kejriwal on Delhi-Punjab knowledge agreement
279.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal signed a Knowledge Sharing Agreement with the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government and said, "It is a unique incident in the history of India." "Governments are signing an agreement to share knowledge...our goal is to learn from each other and move forward. It's a big development," he said soon after signing the agreement.

280.title: 1st all-private astronaut crew to ISS returns after 15 days in orbit
280.article_body: The first all-private astronaut team ever to fly aboard the ISS has successfully landed back on Earth. The crew spent around 15 days in orbit, conducting a variety of science experiments and technology demonstrations. It was led by former NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría and included Canada's Mark Pathy, US-based Larry Connor, and former Israeli Air Force pilot Eytan Stibbe.

281.title: Universities not a place for distributing degrees alone: UP CM
281.article_body: Universities are not a place for distributing degrees alone and it is unfortunate that universities of UP have been "victims" of politics for decades, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "The quality of education was not taken care of. Now that won’t happen. The campaign to free the education department from the mafia will continue with more rigidity," CM Yogi added.

282.title: Covaxin gets approval for restricted emergency use in children aged 6-12 years
282.article_body: Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) has granted restricted emergency use authorisation to Bharat Biotech's Covaxin for children between the age of 6-12 years. The company has been asked to submit safety data, including that on adverse events, with due analysis every 15 days for the first two months and monthly thereafter for five months.

283.title: Ukraine city Kreminna falls to Russia: UK
283.article_body: The British Defense Ministry said the town of Kreminna in Ukraine's eastern Luhansk region has reportedly fallen to Russian forces. Street-to-street fighting had been going on for days in the city in the Luhansk region, making civilian evacuations there impossible. The ministry also said Russian forces are likely attempting to encircle heavily fortified Ukrainian positions in the east of Ukraine.

284.title: Delhi police arrests 3 men for promoting enmity between religious groups
284.article_body: The Delhi police arrested three men in two separate cases for promoting enmity between religious groups and creating disharmony in Khajuri Khas and Seelampur areas. "These boys were uttering threatening words...They also tried to manhandle the complainant...(We) found that the men were trying to disturb the peace in the area," said DCP (Northeast) Sanjay Kumar Sain.

285.title: Everton players have been cheating their manager, the fans: Carragher
285.article_body: Reacting to Everton's 0-2 defeat against Liverpool in the Premier League, ex-Liverpool player Jamie Carragher said, "Everton players have been cheating their manager Frank Lampard and their fans this season." "Everton need to look at themselves because now they are in the bottom three [on the points table], and they have to start fighting for their lives," added Carragher.

286.title: Drunk Thane man slaps policeman trying to resolve fight between him and his wife
286.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested after he, in a drunken state, allegedly slapped a police constable who tried to resolve a fight between him and his wife in Thane. The accused allegedly verbally abused police personnel and tried to attack other constables when he was taken to the police station. Police claimed there were regular complaints from the accused's wife.

287.title: 27-yr-old man dies due to electrocution in Bengaluru, probe underway
287.article_body: A 27-year-old man died due to an electric shock after coming in contact with a broken electric wire near Sanjaynagar in Bengaluru. According to police, the deceased, identified as Kishore, came in contact with the electric wire in a park on Monday night. The police said they have registered a case into the matter.

288.title: Was heartbroken when I got to know about match-fixing in cricket: Taapsee
288.article_body: Recalling her obsession with cricket, actress Taapsee Pannu said, "I was an ardent cricket fan. I used to sit and pray between matches for India to win. My heartbeat rate depended on the way a match was going." "When I got to know about match-fixing that little girl who was obsessed with cricket was heartbroken," she added.

289.title: Humans could suffer 560 catastrophes every year by 2030: UN
289.article_body: If current trends continue the world will go from around 400 disasters per year in 2015 to an onslaught of about 560 catastrophes a year by 2030, according to a UN report. The number of extreme heat waves in 2030 will be three times what it was in 2001 and there will be 30% more droughts, the report predicted.

290.title: I was a meme queen in middle school, kids were pretty mean: Iga Świątek
290.article_body: Reacting to memes made on her on social media, world number one tennis player Iga Świątek said, "Honestly, I was...a 'meme queen' [in]...middle school. But that was pretty mean from the other kids." "Maybe that's another thing I was born to do," added Świątek. "I don't know if I should be happy or sad about that," stated Świątek.

291.title: BJP tries to mislead people when governance fails: KTR
291.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said the BJP uses a “diversionary tactic” of raising issues such as Hanuman Chalisa and Hijab in different states in an attempt to “mislead people when governance fails". "When governance fails, the party in power, especially the BJP, tries to mislead people of the country," Rao added.

292.title: Sri Lanka in talks with China to refinance debt amid crisis
292.article_body: Amid the ongoing economic crisis, the Sri Lankan government has held discussions with China seeking to refinance its debt. "China has indicated their stance is that because they have lent to many countries around the world...they have suggested that they will refinance the debt," said a Sri Lankan minister. The discussions were at an early stage, he added.

293.title: Inmates try smoking tea leaves, rolling up dried grass: Burail Officer
293.article_body: A jail officer said that they have recovered half-burnt rolled papers from barracks prisoners who had a habit of smoking before they were arrested. "Sale of tobacco products...like beedi and cigarettes...has been banned inside the jail since 2014...Some try smoking with tea leaves. Others who do not get tea leaves have tried rolling up dry grass," the officer said.

294.title: Telangana couple kills 23-year-old son addicted to liquor, drugs
294.article_body: A couple in Telangana strangled their 23-year-old son as they were unable to bear the daily suffering at the hands of their liquor and drug addict son. The incident took place in Dharmaram village of Konaraopet Mandal, about 160 km from Hyderabad. The son, Nikhil, used to quarrel with them and resort to violence every day, the police said.

295.title: Hyd police officer gives food to beggar family; video surfaces
295.article_body: Hyderabad's SR Nagar Station House Officer (SHO) on Monday took to Twitter to share a video of a police officer distributing food to a beggar family at a bus stop. The video shows the police officer putting food on plates in front of a woman. A Twitter user reacted to this, saying, "Salute to Telangana police and SR Nagar SHO."

296.title: Afghanistan writes to UNSC over Pak airstrikes which killed 40
296.article_body: The Afghanistan government has written to the UNSC complaining against alleged airstrikes carried out by Pakistan, in which 40 people were said to be killed. In a letter to the UNSC President, Afghanistan Chargé d'affaires called the attack "a flagrant breach of international laws, including humanitarian laws, the principles of UN Charter, the UNGA and UNSC resolutions".

297.title: CSK are putting a lot of pressure on Mitchell Santner: Imran Tahir
297.article_body: Ex-CSK spinner Imran Tahir said CSK are putting a "lot of pressure" on the franchise's all-rounder Mitchell Santner, by asking him to bat at the number three position. "CSK are asking too much from a guy who has always batted down the order," added Tahir. Santner scored nine runs off 15 balls in CSK's defeat against PBKS.

298.title: If there's one team that has complete bowling in IPL 2022, it's RR: Parthiv
298.article_body: Former India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said that RR are the only team in IPL 2022 who have a "complete" bowling attack. "Prasidh Krishna is a different bowler while Obed McCoy is a left-armer. Ashwin and Chahal are a good spin pair. There is Trent Boult as well...they have ticked all the boxes," added Parthiv.

299.title: Meta appeals UK order to sell GIF-sharing platform GIPHY
299.article_body: Facebook-owner Meta has started its appeal against UK's Competition and Markets Authority's ruling that it must sell GIF-sharing platform GIPHY. It argued that its rival Snap offered far less to buy the platform which undermined the rationale used to block the deal. The CMA said it will defend its decision "vigorously". Meta acquired GIPHY in 2020 for $400 million.

300.title: AAP protests outside Guj Vidhan Sabha over school fee hike; 8 held
300.article_body: Eight AAP members, including state general secretary Manoj Sorathiya, were detained outside Gujarat Vidhan Sabha in Gandhinagar during a protest over a fee hike in private schools on Monday. The party also shared pictures and videos of the incident online. "State government is misusing police and administration to illegally pick up AAP workers...protesting for the sake of parents," Sorathiya said.

301.title: Radhika wraps up 'Vikram Vedha' shoot, says 'Felt nice to get back on set'
301.article_body: Radhika Apte has wrapped up the shoot of 'Vikram Vedha', an upcoming Hindi film which is a remake of the Tamil neo-noir action-thriller film of the same name. The actress, while sharing her experience, said, "I had a lovely time...It felt nice to get back on...set." The film will feature Hrithik Roshan as Vedha and Saif Ali Khan as Vikram.

302.title: Sanjay Leela Bhansali is a magician, he only thinks about his movie: Alia
302.article_body: Bhansali Productions, the production house behind 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', on Monday shared a behind-the-scenes clip from the film's set wherein Alia Bhatt shared her experience of working with the director Sanjay Leela Bhansali. The actress called him a magician and said, "He only eats, breathes, drinks, thinks about his movie and that's automatically what happens on his set when you're around."

303.title: Delhi's max temperature may touch 42°C today; heatwave predicted from April 28-30
303.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi is likely to reach 42°C on Tuesday, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Strong winds are also predicted for the day after parts of Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR) witnessed strong winds on Monday night. The city is likely to face heatwave conditions from April 28 to 30 and May 2.

304.title: NCPCR seeks report after 5 kids injured in crude bomb blast in WB
304.article_body: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has taken cognisance of an incident in West Bengal's Malda, wherein five children were injured after some crude bombs, which they mistook for balls, exploded. The child rights body has asked the state DGP and Chief Secretary to submit a report on the matter within 10 days and order a probe.

305.title: NATO, in essence, is engaged in a war with us: Russia
305.article_body: After deliveries of western weapons to Ukraine, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said, "NATO, in essence, is engaged in a war with Russia through a proxy and is arming that proxy." "These weapons will be a legitimate target for Russia's military acting within the context of the special operation," he told state television in an interview.

306.title: Harbhajan Singh reveals his all-time IPL XI, names MS Dhoni as captain
306.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has named his all-time IPL XI, which includes five Indians and six foreigners. Harbhajan included MS Dhoni in the XI as wicketkeeper and captain. He named Chris Gayle and Rohit Sharma as openers. Other players include Virat Kohli, Shane Watson, AB de Villiers, Ravindra Jadeja, Kieron Pollard, Sunil Narine, Lasith Malinga and Jasprit Bumrah.

307.title: I was like '7 bloody calls? What's happened here?': Shastri on BCCI hiring him in 2014
307.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri revealed his job "instantly" changed when BCCI hired him as Team India director without any warning in 2014. "I was commentating...I came off air to find 6-7 missed calls. [I was like] 'Seven bloody calls? What's happened here?'" he said. "[The BCCI] just said: 'We want you to take over...starting tomorrow...at any cost'," Shastri stated.

308.title: Did China just gain a bit of leverage over town square: Bezos on Musk's Twitter takeover
308.article_body: Sharing a tweet by a journalist pointing out connections between Tesla and the Chinese government following Elon Musk's deal to buy Twitter, Jeff Bezos tweeted, "Did the Chinese government just gain a bit of leverage over the town square?" He added, "My own answer...is probably not. The more likely outcome...is complexity in China for Tesla, rather than censorship at Twitter."

309.title: Kendriya Vidyalaya revises admission guidelines, removes MP quota
309.article_body: The Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan (KVS) issued revised admission guidelines for academic year 2022-2023 and discontinued the MPs' discretionary quota in recommending admission of students to Kendriya Vidyalaya. The new guidelines also stated that children orphaned due to COVID-19 pandemic will be considered for admission over and above the class strength under PM CARES for Children Scheme.

310.title: Russia is targeting railways to cut arms supply routes: Ukraine
310.article_body: Ukraine's military command has accused Russia of attacking the nation's railway infrastructure in order to disrupt supply lines for military equipment from foreign countries. It comes after Ukrainian Railways reported that five train stations in central and western Ukraine had been hit by Russian missile strikes. Many trains reportedly have been forced to alter routes and schedules after attacks.

311.title: Hackers steal NFTs worth $3 mn in Bored Ape club's Instagram hack
311.article_body: Hackers have stolen NFTs worth $3 million from owners after hacking into the Instagram account belonging to the Bored Ape Yacht Club collection. They uploaded a post that linked to a cloned version of BAYC's website and included a free crypto tokens offer. Hacked owners together lost four Bored Apes, six Mutant Apes and three Bored Ape Kennel Club NFTs.

312.title: PM Modi gives equal respect to all CMs of India: Tripura CM
312.article_body: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb said that PM Narendra Modi gives equal respect to all CMs. "PM Modi gives equal importance to the CM of Tripura and CM of Uttar Pradesh, there is no disparity," Deb said. "PM specially sanctioned ₹7 crore for constructing a high-tech building for the old age homes. This is the vision of PM," he said.

313.title: If anyone wants to chant Hanuman Chalisa do it in homes, temples: Raut
313.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said if anyone wants to chant Hanuman Chalisa then they can do it in their homes or temples. "Devendra Fadnavis (BJP leader) is misleading people. No one is punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa," Raut added. "Trying to get inside someone else's home and destroy peace to chant Hanuman Chalisa is wrong," Raut stated.

314.title: Gang of inter-state burglars held in Bengaluru, gold worth ₹1.1 cr seized
314.article_body: Bengaluru Police have busted a gang of three inter-state burglars and seized gold jewellery worth ₹1.1 crore. According to the police, the men were arrested following a spate of house burglaries reported in Sanjaynagar over the past month. All cases had a similar modus operandi wherein the window grilles were cut open using an electric machine, police said.

315.title: Drunk man hits home guard with SUV, arrested by Gurugram police
315.article_body: The Gurugram Police have arrested a man for allegedly hitting a home guard with his SUV in an inebriated condition. Police said that the man was produced before a court on Monday which sent him to judicial custody. Police added that incident happened on intervening night of April 23 and 24 when the car was intercepted but did not stop.

316.title: Mumbai, Thane witness blackouts after major glitch at Padgha distribution centre
316.article_body: A major glitch at the Padgha electricity distribution centre in Maharashtra's Thane led to blackouts in many areas in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Panvel, Palghar, Vasai Virar and others on Tuesday morning. There was a burst in the transmission centre which led to power failure in many areas of Mumbai Metropolitan Region, a Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited official said.

317.title: Ensure no hate speeches are made at religious event tomorrow: SC to U'khand govt
317.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday told the Uttarakhand government to ensure no hate speeches are made at the Dharma Sansad event scheduled in Roorkee on Wednesday. "If hate speech is not stopped, the [Uttarakhand] Chief Secretary will be held responsible," the SC added. Hate speeches were allegedly delivered at a religious gathering in Haridwar in December last year.

318.title: 115 more complain of diarrhoea after consuming contaminated water in Punjab
318.article_body: A day after 15 people fell ill after consuming contaminated water in Gazipur village of Punjab's Zirakpur, 115 more cases of diarrhoea were reported from the area. The Health Department reached the village and organised a medical camp. Officials said a team conducted door-to-door surveys and samples were also collected. The Zirakpur civic body supplied water tankers to the village.

319.title: 3 foreign nationals held for cheating prospective kidney donors in B'luru
319.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested three foreign nationals, including two people from Nigeria and one from Ghana, for allegedly cheating prospective kidney donors. The accused created fake websites of various city hospitals and lured kidney donors for transplants with advertisements offering up to ₹4 crore, police said. They were arrested following a complaint by medical director of Sagar Hospitals.

320.title: Punjab DGP launches web portal to report cyber crimes
320.article_body: Punjab DGP VK Bhawra launched a one interface multifunctional web portal for the citizens to immediately report all kinds of cyber crimes and frauds. The web portal, cybercrime.punjabpolice.gov.in, was launched on Monday. Besides lodging all kinds of cyber crimes and cyber financial frauds, the user can also track the status of their complaint using this portal, Bhawra said.

321.title: First genome sequencing lab in western UP to come up in Greater Noida
321.article_body: The first genome sequencing laboratory in western UP will likely begin its operation by May 10 at the Government Institute of Medical Sciences (GIMS) in Kasna, Greater Noida. "We will initially be able to test about 50 samples on a daily basis," GIMS director said. As of now, samples are sent to Delhi or Lucknow for genome sequencing.

322.title: Ex-eBay exec pleads guilty to harassing US couple critical of eBay
322.article_body: James Baugh, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, has pleaded guilty to harassing a US couple, who ran a website critical of eBay, by arranging anonymous messages on Twitter and sending home deliveries that included a bloody pig mask and live insects. Baugh has pleaded guilty to nine counts including conspiracy, stalking through interstate travel and witness tampering.

323.title: 2 Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists held with ammunition in J&K's Baramulla
323.article_body: Two terrorists associated with Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) were arrested with arms and ammunition in J&K's Baramulla, the Indian Army said on Tuesday. They were apprehended in a joint operation led by Baramulla Police, 29 Rashtriya Rifles and Central Reserve Police Force. "The army...recovered two Chinese pistols, two pistol magazines, ten ammunition pistols and two Chinese grenades," the army said.

324.title: New parking lot at Pune airport likely to open by July
324.article_body: The newly built multi-storeyed parking lot at Lohegaon airport in Pune is likely to be made available for public use from July 2022. "The four-storeyed parking lot is built by the Airports Authority of India (AAI) near the airport entry gate," said Santosh Dhoke, Pune airport director. Notably, multilevel car parking is part of Pune airport's expansion project.

325.title: Kim Jong-un vows to develop N Korea's nuclear forces ‘at maximum speed’
325.article_body: In a speech during a military parade on Monday night, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un vowed to bolster his nuclear forces at "maximum speed" and threatened to use them if provoked, state media reported on Tuesday. The parade to mark the armed forces' founding anniversary featured North Korea's largest known intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), the Hwasong-17, and other weapons.

326.title: Will resign after meeting my father: RJD MLA Tej Pratap Yadav
326.article_body: RJD MLA from Bihar's Hasanpur Tej Pratap Yadav on Monday tweeted that he will submit his resignation soon after meeting his father and party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav. The MLA, however, did not clarify if he'll be resigning from party membership, his post or both. "I followed my father's footsteps and gave respect to all the party workers," Tej said.

327.title: Don't know which direction Twitter will go: CEO Parag to employees over Musk takeover
327.article_body: On being asked about Elon Musk's plans for Twitter following a $44-billion takeover, CEO Parag Agrawal told his employees, "Once the deal closes...we don't know which direction [Twitter] will go." "When we've an opportunity to speak with Elon...it's a question we should address with him," he added on being asked whether ex-US President Donald Trump would be allowed to return.

328.title: Governor is nothing but a postman: Tamil Nadu CM on anti-NEET Bill row
328.article_body: Commenting on the row over the anti-NEET Bill, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that the Governor of the state RN Ravi is "nothing but a postman". "We're not asking the Governor for approval for the Bill...Governor does not have the authority to do so," he added. "What we ask is, send the Bill to the President," Stalin further said.

329.title: SC dismisses plea seeking judicial inquiry into recent communal clashes in states
329.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday dismissed a PIL seeking judicial inquiry into incidents of communal violence during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti celebrations in some states. The petitioner had contended that the situation is alarming and only a one-sided investigation was underway. "Do not ask for such reliefs which can't be granted by the court," the SC said.

330.title: Aamir wishes students appearing for board exams, says 'Re chachu, All is well'
330.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan shared a note on his social media handle and wished the students who'll soon be giving their board exams. The note read, "Best of luck to all students who'll soon be giving their exams! Give...your best, and leave the rest...and remember...Re chachu, All is well!" On the professional front, he'll be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

331.title: Arshdeep, Rabada have been great for us: Mayank after win vs CSK
331.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal praised Arshdeep Singh and Kagiso Rabada after their 11-run win against CSK, stating that the pacers have been great for them in the ongoing IPL season. "Arshdeep bowled exceedingly well...Even Rabada bowled well, to get Ruturaj and Rayudu at that stage," said Mayank. Arshdeep and Rabada both conceded 23 runs each in their four overs.

332.title: Glitch in school bus engine causes fire in Thane, 16 children rescued
332.article_body: A school bus caught fire in Thane on Monday. 16 students had narrow escape after the bus caught fire at 1:50 pm. Thane Traffic Police rescued the children and doused the fire. Police said that a glitch in the engine of the bus led to fire. The Regional Disaster Management Cell said fire was doused in 15 to 20 minutes.

333.title: Andhra Pradesh tops in curbing malaria, gets national award
333.article_body: Andhra Pradesh has emerged as the best-performing state in terms of curbing malaria and was awarded for it by the Union Health Ministry on the occasion of World Malaria Day on Monday. The state is said to have reduced malaria cases by over five times in three years - from 6,040 cases in 2018 to 1,139 in 2021.

334.title: Woman gangraped, murdered by men who offered her lift, body thrown in well in Raj
334.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped and murdered by men who offered to drop her in their car while she was going to her in-laws' house in Dausa district of Rajasthan, police said. The main accused in the case has been arrested, police added. The body of the woman was dumped in a dry well.

335.title: Abandoned baby boy found on railway tracks in Andhra Pradesh
335.article_body: An abandoned baby boy was found on the railway tracks of Vizianagaram district in Andhra Pradesh on Monday, the police said. "A person saw the baby on the railway tracks in a bag," BS Rao, Kothavalasa Circle Inspector, said. "We have handed over the baby to the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS)," the police said.

336.title: Elon Musk's old Twitter chat on 'buying Twitter' goes viral
336.article_body: After Twitter accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company, an old Twitter chat between Musk and a Business Insider host has gone viral. In 2017, Musk tweeted, "I love Twitter," to which the host replied, "You should buy it then." Responding to the host, Musk had tweeted, "How much is it?"

337.title: HC to hear plea against lifetime minister status to ex-Goa CM
337.article_body: The Bombay High Court has agreed to hear a plea challenging the lifetime Cabinet minister status accorded to former Goa CM Pratapsingh Rane. Rane was bestowed the status in January ahead of the Assembly elections in the state. "The Constitution does not provide for conferring Cabinet [minister] status on any individual other than a current minister," argued a lawyer.

338.title: EV startup Fisker CEO removes Twitter account after Musk's $44-bn deal
338.article_body: US EV startup Fisker CEO Henrik Fisker's Twitter account has ceased to exist after Elon Musk's $44-biilion Twitter deal announcement. Fisker said in a tweet Monday that his followers should look for him on Instagram for future updates, without giving away any additional details. Fisker, who worked with Tesla earlier, was sued by Tesla claiming he stole confidential information.

339.title: 4 of family killed, 8 injured in road accident in Andhra's Tirupati
339.article_body: At least four members of a family were killed and eight others were injured in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati around midnight on Sunday, officials said on Monday. The accident took place when the mini-van which victims were travelling in collided with a lorry. "Three of them died on the spot...another girl died while being shifted to hospital," Tirupati district collector said.

340.title: I don't believe in term 'pan-India films', what does that even mean: Abhishek
340.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said that he doesn't believe in the term 'pan-India films'. "What does that even mean? Do we use this for any other industry? Not at all," he added. "We are a large cinema-going population and we love our cinema. It has never mattered which language it has been made in," Abhishek further said.

341.title: Could've continued as sellable leading man but didn't want to take stress: Anil
341.article_body: Speaking about portraying elder characters in films, actor Anil Kapoor said, "Everybody said I could have waited for 8-10 years more to take a transition. For 6-7 years more I could've continued as the so-called sellable kind of leading man." "I said, 'I don't want to go through this stress now...let...the younger leading [men] take over those responsibilities'," he added.

342.title: Reduce production of sugar, focus on ethanol: Gadkari to Maha's mill owners
342.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged the sugar mill owners of Maharashtra's Solapur to reduce the production of sugar and increase the production of ethanol amid rising concerns over surplus sugarcane production. If the production goes on like this, then farmers would have no option other than suicide, he added. India's sugar exports surged by 64.9% in the financial year 2021-22.

343.title: We're not getting good starts, that's where we're lacking: Jadeja
343.article_body: After CSK suffered their sixth defeat in eight games in IPL 2022, captain Ravindra Jadeja said they're lacking in getting good starts in the first six overs of the games. "We did not execute our plans very well [against PBKS]. He [Rayudu] was batting brilliantly...but if we could've restricted them to under 175, it would've been good," he added.

344.title: 5 held during drive against stunt biking in Lucknow, 12 two-wheelers seized
344.article_body: Police on Monday seized 12 two-wheelers and arrested five persons from different parts of Lucknow city, as part of a drive against stunt biking and dangerous driving in public places, police said. Raids are on to arrest more stunt bikers who risk the lives of others and cause inconvenience to morning walkers, police added.

345.title: Man kills woman, her parents after she refused love proposal in UP
345.article_body: A man was arrested after he along with some assailants allegedly murdered a woman and her parents by slitting their throats in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Monday, police said. The incident occurred as the arrested accused wanted to have a love affair with the woman, but she refused, Gorakhpur SSP said. A shovel was used in the incident, police added.

346.title: Shop owner, son kill drunk man for eating samosa without permission in MP
346.article_body: A 40-year-old man was killed after he allegedly walked into a shop in a drunken state and ate a samosa without the owner's permission in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The owner scolded him and then hit him on the head with a stick, an officer said. The shop owner and his 20-year-old son have been arrested for murder.

347.title: Arjun's next film with Mudassar Aziz titled 'Meri Patni Ka Remake': Report
347.article_body: Arjun Kapoor's forthcoming comedy film with director Mudassar Aziz is reportedly titled 'Meri Patni Ka Remake'. "The title blends well with the world that Mudassar is trying to create in his comic caper," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. "The script has scope of two female leads and...talks are on with two actresses to play the parts," the source added.

348.title: Those teaching Hindutva were hiding during Babri demolition: Uddhav
348.article_body: Speaking on the ongoing Azaan and Hanuman Chalisa controversy, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that those teaching him Hindutva were hiding in a "rat hole" when Babri Masjid was demolished. The decision on construction of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya was not taken by the BJP government but it was Supreme Court that paved the way for the same, he added.

349.title: Beijing to test 20 million for COVID-19 amid rising cases
349.article_body: Beijing on Tuesday launched mass COVID-19 testing for about 20 million residents amid rising virus cases.
