People in the Chinese capital have resorted to panic buying, stocking up food and supplies as fears grow that Beijing may be placed under a strict lockdown like Shanghai. Most of Shanghai's 25 million residents have been under lockdown for more than two weeks.

350.title: 7 workers injured in blast at power plant's boiler tube in Telangana
350.article_body: Seven workers were injured in a blast at a power plant in Telangana's Jayashankar Bhupalpally. The condition of three workers is stated to be critical. As per initial information, the explosion took place at a boiler tube in the 500 MW power generation unit due to heat. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot, following which the blaze was doused.

351.title: I'll faint if I get Aamir, Urmila's response on 'Mangta Hai Kya': Palak Tiwari
351.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari said that she would faint if she gets actor Aamir Khan and actress Urmila Matondkar's response on her and actor Aditya Seal's new song 'Mangta hai Kya'. Aditya said if that happens, he would have checked all boxes from his checklist. The song is a new version of the song from Aamir and Urmila's movie 'Rangeela'.

352.title: Trump held in contempt for not giving business documents for probe
352.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has been held in contempt of court by a New York judge for not handing over business-related documents for a probe. Judge Arthur Engoron imposed a fine of $10,000 per day on Trump until he submits the documents. Authorities are investigating if his company, The Trump Organization, misreported values of assets to get loans.

353.title: India reports 1,399 COVID-19 deaths as Assam adds 1,347 backlog casualties
353.article_body: India reported 2,483 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The country reported 1,399 COVID-19 deaths as Assam and Kerala added 1,347 and 47 backlog casualties respectively. Active cases in India stand at 15,636, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,622, according to the data shared by the ministry.

354.title: 118-year-old French nun named world's oldest living person
354.article_body: After the death of Japan's Kane Tanaka aged 119, Guinness World Records said that 118-year-old Sister André, who was born on February 11, 1904, is now officially the oldest person alive. Sister André had worked as a teacher, a governess and looked after children during World War II. She's the third-oldest French person and the third-oldest European person ever recorded.

355.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal shares pic from hospital after 6-hour breast cancer surgery
355.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of herself from the hospital after undergoing a six-hour breast cancer surgery. "I woke up cancer free...It's a long road to recovery, but the great thing is...it's only going to get better now. The worst's over," she wrote. "Thank you guys for sticking with me through this," she added.

356.title: Man killed in mall in UP's Noida after fight with bar staff
356.article_body: A man was killed on Monday night in Gardens Galleria Mall in Uttar Pradesh's Noida, police said. "Some people got into a fight with bar staff during which one person was severely injured," Additional DCP Ranvijay Singh said. "He was taken to hospital, where doctors declared him dead and an FIR has been registered," Singh further said.

357.title: If Musk can afford Twitter, he can pay his taxes: US Congresswoman
357.article_body: US Congresswoman Marie Newman reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal, saying, "If he can afford Twitter, he can damn well afford to pay his fair share in taxes." She highlighted that Musk had paid $0 in federal taxes in 2018. "We need a Billionaire Tax NOW," she added. US Senator Elizabeth Warren has called the deal "dangerous" for democracy.

358.title: Cong should take 'backseat' in states where regional parties are formidable: Tejashwi
358.article_body: Talking about forming a strong Opposition alliance against BJP in the 2024 general elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav said that Congress should take a "backseat" in states where regional parties are a formidable force. Congress must focus on over 200 seats on which it is in a direct fight with the saffron party, Yadav added.

359.title: NATO warships arrive at Finland port for 2-day exercise
359.article_body: Three NATO warships have reached Finland's Turku port for a two-day training exercise with the Finnish navy. This comes amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. The Latvian, Estonian and Dutch ships will train with two of Finland's minehunter vessels, according to Finnish defence forces. The exercise will begin on April 28.

360.title: Don't underestimate the risks of nuclear war, the danger is real: Russia to the world
360.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has told the world not to underestimate the risks of nuclear war. "The risks now are considerable," Lavrov said. "I would not want to elevate those risks artificially. Many would like that. The danger is serious, real," he further said. "This only means Moscow senses defeat," Ukraine said after Lavrov's statement.

361.title: Ban on carrying guns at wedding functions, parties under Sec 144 in MP's Morena
361.article_body: A ban on carrying guns in gatherings, including wedding functions and parties, has been imposed under Section 144 of the CrPC in Madhya Pradesh's Morena, in view of recent fatal incidents, police said. According to Morena Superintendent of Police (SP), all police stations have been asked to register a case and revoke licenses in case such incidents are reported again.

362.title: Allahabad HC dismisses PIL asking Adityanath to take oath in 'real name'
362.article_body: The Allahabad High Court dismissed a PIL seeking direction that UP CM Yogi Adityanath may be asked to take the oath as CM again in his "real name". According to the petitioner, different names were being used by the CM like "Adityanath", "Yogi Adityanath", etc. The High Court bench also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the petitioner.

363.title: J'khand CM used his position to give industrial land to wife: Ex-CM
363.article_body: Former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das on Monday alleged that state CM Hemant Soren, who holds Industries portfolio, used his position to get 11 acres of land in Ranchi's industrial area allotted to his wife Kalpana. He claimed that Soren's political representative and media adviser were also given mining leases. "[Soren] is supposed to give answers," he said.

364.title: Dad worked round the clock, slept on sets; I'd miss having him at home: Bobby
364.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol said that as a child, he missed having his father and actor Dharmendra at home. "Sometimes he would take me to shoot locations but even then, he would be busy. He would literally be working round the clock, so that he could build a lovely empire for us. He would even sleep on sets," Bobby added.

365.title: Dalit man beaten to death over land dispute in UP's Firozabad
365.article_body: A Dalit man was allegedly beaten to death by a group of people belonging to the upper caste in UP's Firozabad district. According to Jai Singh's brother, few people had been pressuring him to vacate the plot he had purchased in 2021. An FIR was registered against six people and two of the accused have been arrested, police said.

366.title: Raj govt suspends 3 officials after 300-yr-old temple demolished in Alwar
366.article_body: Rajasthan government suspended three officials, including Rajgarh Sub-Divisional Magistrate, after a 300-year-old Shiva temple was demolished in Alwar on Friday. The other suspended officials are Rajgarh Municipality Board's chairman and Executive Officer of the Nagar Panchayat. The demolition was done to remove illegal encroachments and the temple's idols, DM Shivprasad Nakate had said.

367.title: 'Grenade-like' rusted ball triggers bomb scare in Delhi's RK Puram
367.article_body: A 'grenade-like' device was spotted in Delhi's RK Puram area on Monday, after which, Delhi Police launched the bomb disposal protocols. A senior police officer said that the device was originally assumed to be a grenade but it was found to be a rusted ball after investigation. Police said they were taking all precautions.

368.title: 7 held for leaking question paper of Junior Office Assistant exam in Himachal
368.article_body: Police arrested seven persons from Mandi for allegedly leaking the question paper of the Junior Office Assistant exam conducted on Sunday by the Himachal Pradesh Staff Selection Commission. One accused revealed that a staffer at Abhilashi College of Education and deputy centre superintendent had provided him with the question paper before the commencement of the exam, a police official said.

369.title: Virat must stay patient at the start of innings, runs will come: Shastri
369.article_body: Ahead of RCB's match against RR, ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said RCB's top-order needs to step up if they want to go the distance in the ongoing IPL season. Talking about Virat Kohli's form, Shastri stated, "Virat must stay patient at the start, play grounded shots...I've no doubt that runs will start flowing. But he has to give it time."

370.title: Amid rumours of leaving Cong, Vijender Singh posts pic with Priyanka
370.article_body: Amid the ongoing rumours of boxer Vijender Singh leaving the Congress for AAP, the 36-year-old Olympic medallist posted a picture with senior Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday. "It was wonderful conversing with dynamic leader @priyankagandhi ji who is doing so much for the betterment of the youth. Her progressive approach can help us gain newer heights," read the caption.

371.title: PBKS' Arshdeep does 'chariot riding' celebration against CSK, IPL share video
371.article_body: PBKS fast bowler Arshdeep Singh celebrated taking the wicket of CSK's Mitchell Santner by doing a 'chariot riding' gesture. Reacting to Arshdeep's celebration, a fan wrote, "Love this celebration." Santner was clean bowled by Arshdeep for 9(15). Arshdeep recorded figures of 4-0-23-1 as PBKS defeated CSK by 11 runs.

372.title: Rishi Dhawan's glasses may have reminded him of something: Jaffer on Rayudu's 78(39)
372.article_body: Referring to Ambati Rayudu smashing 78(39) against PBKS, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Rayudu batting even more aggressively tonight. Rishi Dhawan's glasses may have reminded him of something." Jaffer was referring to Rayudu's 'Just ordered a new set of 3D glasses to watch World Cup' tweet which he posted in 2019 after not being included in India's World Cup squad.

373.title: 9 arrested for lynching Maha man over suspicion of stealing halogen light
373.article_body: Nine persons, including two sons of a former Shiv Sena corporator, have been arrested in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for allegedly lynching a 30-year-old man over suspicion of stealing a halogen light. The victim's family learnt about the incident after receiving a video footage of the assault, which was recorded by the accused. The family members showed the video to the police.

374.title: UK to send 'small number' of Stormer armoured vehicles to Ukraine
374.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said that Britain will send a "small number" of Stormer armoured vehicles fitted with launchers for anti-air missiles to Ukraine. He added that British assessments showed that around 15,000 Russian personnel have been killed in the war. Russia has lost over 2,000 armoured vehicles and more than 60 helicopters and fighter planes, he further said.

375.title: Billionaires like Musk play by different rules: US Senator on Twitter deal
375.article_body: US Senator Elizabeth Warren reacted to Elon Musk's $44 billion Twitter deal, saying, "Billionaires like Elon Musk play by a different set of rules than everyone else, accumulating power for their own gain." She also called the deal "dangerous for our democracy". "We need a wealth tax and strong rules to hold Big Tech accountable," Warren added.

376.title: BMC develops software for tracking & updates on nullah cleaning work
376.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has developed a software where citizens would be able to track the nullah cleaning work in their localities. Updates related to cleaning work will also be uploaded on software. Officials said software will provide details like areas where nullahs were cleaned, quantity of silt deposited at dumping sites and silt removed on a particular day.

377.title: Passenger shares pic of broken armrest on Air India plane; DGCA says 'repair it'
377.article_body: DGCA has asked Tata Group-owned Air India to repair its aircraft after a passenger shared pictures of the plane's dirty panel and broken armrest on social media. DGCA asked the airline to rectify the problem as soon as possible. The plane will be in Kolkata on Monday night and the repair works will be done during that time, officials said.

378.title: Delhi AIIMS nurses union go on indefinite strike from today
378.article_body: Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) nurses union began an indefinite strike at 8 am on Tuesday. This comes after union's president Harish Kajla was suspended after protests over staff shortage. The union demanded immediate revocation of Kajla's suspension and stopping of all kinds of retaliative measures against union executives and union members of the main OT.

379.title: Elon is the singular solution I trust: Jack Dorsey on Musk's $44-bn Twitter takeover
379.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter, the micro-blogging platform's billionaire  Co-founder Jack Dorsey tweeted, "In principle...I don’t believe anyone should own or run Twitter." He added, "It wants to be a public good at a protocol level, not a company. Solving for the problem of it being a company however...Elon is the singular solution I trust."

380.title: My number got leaked online; random people used to call me everyday: Divyenndu
380.article_body: Recalling an incident from the past where he used to get random calls, 'Mirzapur' actor Divyenndu Sharma said, "After 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', my number got leaked on the internet, and I used to get random calls from people." "Then one...day, one of my fans messaged me that my number was...on the internet and...I needed to change my number," he added.

381.title: 81.5 kg marijuana seized in Bengaluru; 2 arrested
381.article_body: Two persons were arrested while attempting to smuggle 81.5 kg marijuana in Bengaluru on Monday, said police. The accused, identified as Eeneshwar and Nadeem, both aged 25, reportedly used to get the drugs from their suppliers in Andhra Pradesh and bring it to Bengaluru, hidden in goods vehicles. The two have been booked under NDPS Act.

382.title: Morgan Stanley acting as Musk's lead adviser in $44 bn Twitter deal
382.article_body: Morgan Stanley is acting as Elon Musk's lead adviser in his $44 billion Twitter deal. Bank of America and Barclays have also advised him. At least nine other banks are reportedly helping Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and Barclays provide $25.5 billion in debt for the deal. Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, and boutique investment bank Allen advised Twitter.

383.title: Punjab police constable arrested for taking bribe
383.article_body: A constable in the Punjab police was arrested for allegedly taking a bribe from a car driver. The constable, identified as Harpreet Singh, tried to flee after Mohali's Kharar police officials came to arrest him. The complaint was made by Inspector Satinder Singh who alleged that the car driver was demanding his money back from Constable Harpreet Singh.

384.title: As a tax payer I want to know why is there a power crisis in Jharkhand: Sakshi Dhoni
384.article_body: Sakshi Dhoni, wife of former India cricket captain MS Dhoni, on Monday tweeted, "As a tax payer of Jharkhand just want to know why is there a power crisis in Jharkhand since so many years?" "We are doing our part by consciously making sure we save energy," she wrote. This comes as load shedding is being done in Jharkhand.

385.title: Vijay hosts dinner for cast and crew of 'Beast', director Nelson pens note
385.article_body: Actor Vijay hosted dinner for the cast and crew of his latest movie 'Beast'. The dinner was attended by Pooja Hegde, Anirudh Ravichander, Aparna Das and director Nelson Dilipkumar. Nelson on Monday took to Twitter to share a picture from the dinner party with a note that read, "It was a fun-filled and memorable evening with the whole team."

386.title: Chhattisgarh makes face masks compulsory again amid COVID-19 surge
386.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government on Monday decided to reimpose COVID-19 protocols, including mandatory wearing of masks in offices and public places, in view of rising COVID-19 cases in some states. "Spitting at public places is prohibited. Social distancing norms will have to be followed in public places," the order states. Chhattisgarh had lifted the mask mandate on April 12.

387.title: Won't return to Twitter even if account reinstated after Musk takeover: Trump
387.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has said he'll not return to social media platform Twitter even if his account is reinstated following the platform's purchase by billionaire Elon Musk. Trump added he will formally join his own Truth Social startup over the next seven days. "Musk will make improvements to Twitter and he is a good man," Trump further said.

388.title: Centre writes to Raj over Class 12 exam paper questions on Congress
388.article_body: Union Education Ministry has written a letter to the Rajasthan government asking for its input on news reports that the state board's Class 12 political science paper had six questions about Congress' "achievements". The questions asked included- 'Discuss in brief the Congress as a Social and Ideological Alliance' and 'Which party dominated the first three general elections in India?'

389.title: In a first, Karnataka govt hospital gets hyperbaric oxygen unit
389.article_body: In a first for a government facility in Karnataka, Bengaluru's Victoria Hospital got a hyperbaric oxygen chamber set up at ₹3.5 crore. It is an airtight room, pressurised with pure oxygen, used in the treatment of carbon monoxide poisoning, gangrene, wounds and other conditions. Inaugurating the facility, Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said the treatment sessions would be free.

390.title: Demolition drive begins to clear encroachments from Gurugram's Banjara market
390.article_body: Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) demolished over 14 acres of makeshift shops and hutments to reclaim encroached land at Banjara market located in Gurugram's Sectors 52A and 53. The entire encroached land would be cleared in a two-day drive, officials said. Home decor and furniture items were sold in the Banjara market inhabited by Gadiya Lohars nomadic community.

391.title: Playing the lead is my priority right now: Shefali Shah
391.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said playing the lead role is her priority right now. "Writers are writing stuff for me. Directors are working on projects thinking of me. I've waited for a very long time for this," Shefali said, adding, "I'm glad that people are finally looking at me as a lead or...parallel lead...That's what I want to keep doing."

392.title: I focus on process, result will take care of itself: Dhawan on 88*(59) vs CSK
392.article_body: PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, who was named Man of the Match for his unbeaten 88-run knock against CSK, said he's focusing on the "process" in the ongoing IPL season. "The process, I always talk about it, I focus on it. About my fitness, my approach, I keep working on those skills. The result will take care of itself," he stated.

393.title: 124 districts in India reported 'zero' malaria cases: Mandaviya
393.article_body: India has made remarkable progress in its fight against malaria, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on World Malaria Day on Monday. He added that 124 districts in India have reported “zero” malaria cases. There is a need for frontline health workers such as ASHAs and ANMs to raise awareness about the diagnosis and treatment of the disease, Mandaviya stated.

394.title: Played waiter in Shool; they said they'll pay ₹2,500, never got it: Nawazuddin
394.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that he played a waiter in 'Shool'. "They said they will pay me ₹2,500, but I've never gotten it...There have been many such cases...but this one I remember very well," he said, adding, "I visited their office...for 6-7 months...They wouldn't pay me....but offered me food...So then I started visiting them at lunch time...my money got settled."

395.title: Hyd police arrest 3 inter-state drug traffickers, seize 78 kg ganja
395.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Monday that an inter-state drug trafficking racket has been busted and three people were arrested in the matter. The police added that they have also seized about 78 kg of ganja, three mobile phones and two four-wheelers from the accused. The drugs were found during checking near Keesara, the police further said.

396.title: It's important to respect Sonam's privacy: Harsh Varrdhan on sister's pregnancy
396.article_body: Speaking about her sister, actress Sonam Kapoor's pregnancy, actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor said, "I think it's nice that everybody is kind of wanting to know about her because Sonam is such a big personality. So, obviously, everybody wants to share that happiness." "[But] it would also be important to respect [her] privacy...give [her] that space as well," he added.

397.title: Finland, Sweden to apply for NATO membership together in May: Reports
397.article_body: Finland and Sweden will apply for NATO membership together in May this year, local media reported on Monday. Finland, which shares a 1,300-km border with Russia, and Sweden are considering joining the US-led military alliance following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia has warned that it'd deploy nuclear weapons and hypersonic missiles in the region if both nations join the alliance.

398.title: Commonwealth medallist among 5 held for robbing Hisar bank of ₹16.19 lakh
398.article_body: The Hisar STF on Monday arrested five persons, including a junior Commonwealth Games gold medallist for robbing ₹16.19 lakh from a bank in Hisar on April 18, police said. The Commonwealth Games medallist, Soni, is also serving in the ITBP. "Soni had prepared the plan which he executed with four aides," Hisar SSP, Lokender Singh, said.

399.title: Hyderabad Police arrests vehicle thief, recovers 2 stolen two-wheelers
399.article_body: Hyderabad's Gopalapuram Police on Monday arrested a 42-year-old man for stealing vehicles and recovered two stolen two-wheelers from his possession. According to police, the accused, identified as Pinnoji Jagadish, was arrested following a complaint from a teacher whose bike was stolen from Keyes High School on Sunday. Jagadish was travelling on the stolen bike when he was arrested, police said.

400.title: Heroin worth ₹21 cr seized from Malawian national at Hyderabad airport
400.article_body: Officials of Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested a Malawian national at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (RGIA) with heroin worth ₹21 crore. "The contraband was tightly packed in two polythene covers and was ingeniously concealed in a specially created false bottom, at the base of...trolley bag," the DRI said. The accused was remanded to judicial custody on Monday.

401.title: Massive fire breaks out in garbage pile in Gurugram, 35 fire engines deployed
401.article_body: A massive fire broke out near Sector-6 in a garbage pile in Gurugram's Manesar on Monday night. As many as 35 fire engines have been deployed at the spot, officials said. The videos which have surfaced online show huge flames and a cloud of smoke rising from the area. There are no reports of casualties or injuries as of yet.

402.title: No job cuts at the time: Twitter CEO as Elon Musk acquires company for $44 billion
402.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a deal to acquire Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal told the employees that there won't be any job cuts "at the time". "Once the deal closes...we don't know which direction [Twitter] will go," he added. Parag reportedly told Twitter employees that Musk's transaction to take Twitter private could take six months to complete.
